input: Which statement best explains why photosynthesis is the foundation of most food webs? (a) Sunlight is the source of energy for nearly all ecosystems. (b) Most ecosystems are found on land instead of in water. (c) Carbon dioxide is more available than other gases. (d) The producers in all ecosystems are plants.
output: The producers in all ecosystems are plants. So the answer is (d).

input: Which piece of safety equipment is used to keep mold spores from entering the respiratory system? (a) safety goggles. (b) breathing mask. (c) rubber gloves. (d) lead apron.
output: A breathing mask is used to keep mold spores from entering the respiratory system. So the answer is (b).

input: Meiosis is a type of cell division in which germ cells divide to produce haploid cells. Where does meiosis occur? (a) brain cells. (b) bone cells. (c) muscle cells. (d) ovary cells.
output: Meiosis occurs in the ovary cells. So the answer is (d).

input: Which characteristic describes the texture of a kitten's fur? (a) gray. (b) warm. (c) long. (d) soft.
output: The texture of a kitten's fur is soft. So the answer is (d).

input: Which best describes the structure of an atom? (a) a lightweight core surrounded by neutral particles. (b) a massive core surrounded by negatively-charged particles. (c) a network of interacting positive and negative particles. (d) overlapping layers of neutral, positive, and negative particles.
output: The structure of an atom is a massive core surrounded by negatively-charged particles. So the answer is (b).

input: To express the distance between the Milky Way galaxy and other galaxies, the most appropriate unit of measurement is the (a) meter. (b) kilometer. (c) light-year. (d) astronomical unit.
output: The Milky Way galaxy is about 100,000 light-years from the center of the galaxy to the edge of the galaxy. So the answer is (c).

input: A student has just completed a laboratory activity. What is the last action that the student should perform before leaving the lab area? (a) wash hands. (b) turn off all equipment. (c) put away all glassware. (d) wash instruments and table tops.
output: The last action that a student should perform before leaving the lab area is to wash hands. So the answer is (a).

input: Students are investigating the effects of different fertilizers on plant growth. Which units would be best to measure the mass of the fertilizer used? (a) meters. (b) centimeters. (c) grams. (d) milligrams.
output: The mass of the fertilizer is measured in grams, so the answer is (c).

input: Plants use sunlight to make (a) soil. (b) minerals. (c) food. (d) water.
output: Plants use sunlight to make food. So the answer is (c).

input: Which of these correctly identifies the way materials are transported in a plant? (a) Xylem carries water from the roots to the leaves. (b) Phloem carries minerals from the roots to the leaves. (c) Xylem carries sugars from the flowers to the stems. (d) Phloem carries water from the flowers to the stems.
output: Option (a) is correct. Xylem carries water from the roots to the leaves. So the answer is (a).

input: When trees develop leaves in the spring, 10 changes occur on the forest floor. Why does the development of leaves cause changes on the forest floor? (a) Rainfall increases. (b) Sunlight is reduced. (c) Wind speed increases. (d) Animal migration is stopped.
output: The development of leaves causes changes on the forest floor because the leaves are the food source for many animals. So the answer is (c).

input: The circulatory system and the endocrine system work together in the human body. Which describes one way in which these systems interact? (a) taking in oxygen and transporting it to cells of the body. (b) releasing hormones and transporting them to cells of the body. (c) absorbing nutrients from food and transporting them to cells in the body. (d) collecting waste products from the cells and transporting it out of the body.
output: The circulatory system and the endocrine system work together in the human body. The circulatory system takes in oxygen and transports it to cells of the body. The endocrine system releases hormones and transports them to cells of the body. So the answer is (b).

input: A student throws a ball into the air. While the ball travels up, the speed of the ball decreases. What force causes the ball to slow while traveling up? (a) electricity. (b) gravity. (c) magnetism. (d) tension.
output: Gravity is the force that causes the ball to slow while traveling up. So the answer is (b).

input: Which of these will most likely harm a habitat? (a) planting trees. (b) water pollution. (c) rainfall. (d) sunlight.
output: Planting trees will not harm a habitat. So the answer is (a).

input: All living and nonliving material is composed of (1) air. (2) elements. (3) water. (4) soil.
output: All living and nonliving material is composed of elements. So the answer is (a).

input: Which process best explains how the Grand Canyon became so wide? (a) folding. (b) erosion. (c) deposition. (d) sedimentation.
output: The Grand Canyon was formed by erosion, so the answer is (b).

input: As global temperatures increase, certain organisms will be more affected than others. The changes associated with global warming may result in an increase in sea level. Which organisms will be affected most as a result of the change in sea level? (a) birds that eat fish from shallow waters. (b) fish that live in coral reefs in shallow waters. (c) mammals that swim in cold, deep ocean waters. (d) crustaceans at the bottom of deep sea ocean waters.
output: Option (b), fish that live in coral reefs in shallow waters, will be affected most as a result of the change in sea level. So the answer is (b).

input: A dish of sugar water was left on a window sill. One week later, there were only sugar crystals left in the dish. The water was gone. The best explanation for the appearance of sugar crystals is (a) some of the water was absorbed by the dish. (b) the air condensed. (c) the light shining on the window sill produced more sugar. (d) the water evaporated.
output: The water evaporated, so the answer is (d).

input: Using a softball bat to hit a softball is an example of using which simple machine? (a) pulley. (b) lever. (c) inclined plane. (d) wheel and axle.
output: A lever is a simple machine that is used to increase the force of a small force. So the answer is (b).

input: When an igneous intrusion comes into contact with surrounding rock, the surrounding rock will (a) erode. (b) foliate. (c) precipitate. (d) recrystallize.
output: When an igneous intrusion comes into contact with surrounding rock, the surrounding rock will recrystallize. So the answer is (d).

input: A research scientist writes a paper on the initial regrowth of a forest after a fire has damaged the entire ecosystem. Which title would be best for the paper? (a) Primary Succession. (b) Stable Communities. (c) Climax Communities. (d) Secondary Succession.
output: The answer is (a). Primary succession is the initial regrowth of a forest after a fire has damaged the entire ecosystem. So the answer is (a).

input: Where do plants get most of the energy they need to live and grow? (a) water. (b) soil. (c) air. (d) sunlight.
output: Plants get most of their energy from sunlight. So the answer is (d).

input: Which is a statement about climate? (a) The average temperature yesterday was 15°C. (b) The temperature range today was 10°C to 20°C. (c) The high temperature tomorrow will be 14°C. (d) The average high temperature in May is 20°C.
output: The average temperature yesterday was 15°C is a statement about climate. So the answer is (a).

input: While on a movie set, a stuntman jumps off the roof of a building. As he falls toward an airbag, what is increasing? (a) gravity. (b) wind velocity. (c) kinetic energy. (d) potential energy.
output: The stuntman is falling toward the airbag, so the potential energy is increasing. So the answer is (d).

input: Jessica wants to see cells in an oak tree leaf. Which tool is best for Jessica to use to see the cells? (a) binoculars. (b) microscope. (c) reading glasses. (d) magnifying glass.
output: A magnifying glass is used to see objects that are too small to be seen with the naked eye. So the answer is (d).

input: Biologists conduct investigations to learn about living organisms. Which method helps reduce bias during an investigation? (a) developing a hypothesis after collecting data in the investigation. (b) limiting the amount of background research before the investigation. (c) designing an investigation with repeated trials during the investigation. (d) obtaining other opinions concerning what should happen during the investigation.
output: Option (b) is the correct answer. Limiting the amount of background research before the investigation will help reduce bias during an investigation. So the answer is (b).

input: Which factor is most likely to cause the number of rabbits living in an area to increase? (1) less water. (2) fewer predators. (3) lack of shelter. (4) limited food.
output: Option (4), limited food, is the most likely factor to cause the number of rabbits living in an area to increase. So the answer is (d).

input: Seeds that remain inactive until the right conditions of light, water, and soil are present are called ___. (a) pollen. (b) dormant. (c) flowers. (d) recycled.
output: Seeds that remain inactive until the right conditions of light, water, and soil are present are called dormant. So the answer is (b).

input: What allows a light bulb to give off light? (a) the current flowing through the wire to the light bulb. (b) the light bulb giving electrical energy to the battery. (c) the light bulb generating heat energy. (d) the battery pushing light through the wire.
output: The light bulb gives off light because it is a source of energy. So the answer is (a).

input: What causes sound? (a) sunlight. (b) vibrations. (c) x-rays. (d) pitch.
output: Sound is caused by vibrations. So the answer is (b).

input: Photosynthesis occurs in which of these organisms? (a) Sunflower plant. (b) Mushroom. (c) Sunfish. (d) Luna moth.
output: Photosynthesis occurs in plants, so the answer is (a).

input: In order for cells to grow at a normal rate, they must (a) take in light. (b) be specialized. (c) take in nutrients. (d) be of similar size.
output: Cells must take in nutrients in order to grow at a normal rate. So the answer is (c).

input: Marshall learned that plants need a substance from the air to make their own food. What does a plant take from the air in the presence of sunlight? (a) carbon dioxide. (b) hydrogen. (c) nitrogen. (d) oxygen.
output: Plants take in oxygen from the air in the presence of sunlight. So the answer is (d).

input: Antarctica is a continent at Earth's south pole. Fossils of tropical fern plants were discovered in Antarctica even though these plants do not grow there today. Which conclusion does the fossil evidence best support? (a) Millions of years ago, Antarctica was in a warmer location on Earth. (b) Recently, a natural disaster killed all of the fern plants in Antarctica. (c) Recently, birds stopped carrying the seeds of fern plants to Antarctica. (d) Millions of years ago, Earth's south pole was much colder than it is today.
output: The fossil evidence supports the conclusion that millions of years ago, Antarctica was in a warmer location on Earth. So the answer is (a).

input: Which two theories of Moon formation propose that much or all of the material comprising the Moon came from Earth? (a) The Fission Theory and The Coaccretion Theory. (b) The Coaccretion Theory and The Capture Theory. (c) The Fission Theory and the Giant Impact Theory. (d) The Capture Theory and the Giant Impact Theory.
output: The Fission Theory and the Giant Impact Theory both propose that much or all of the material comprising the Moon came from Earth. So the answer is (a).

input: When white, fluffy clouds appear in Massachusetts, the weather that day will MOST LIKELY be (a) fair. (b) stormy. (c) foggy. (d) rainy.
output: When white, fluffy clouds appear in Massachusetts, the weather that day will be fair. So the answer is (a).

input: Plants and animals are composed of organic compounds. Which of the following are the common elements found in organic compounds? (a) iron, oxygen, nickel, copper. (b) sodium, potassium, gold, hydrogen. (c) helium, neon, argon, krypton. (d) carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen.
output: Option (d) is the correct answer.

input: New research uncovers information that proves that the data from an old theory is partially incorrect. What should the scientific community do about the old theory? (a) remove the old theory from historical records. (b) change the research notes in the original theory. (c) use the new information to update the old theory. (d) ban the public from discussing the old theory.
output: The scientific community should use the new information to update the old theory. So the answer is (c).

input: Which is the greatest benefit of sexual reproduction? (a) capable of reproducing by meiosis. (b) ability to reproduce without a mate. (c) ability to produce genetically different offspring. (d) capable of producing offspring genetically identical to parent.
output: Option (c), ability to produce genetically different offspring is the greatest benefit of sexual reproduction. So the answer is (c).

input: The speed at which sound waves travel depends on the (a) distance between the vibration source and the receiver. (b) type of material through which the sound travels. (c) size of the object making the sound. (d) type of device making the sound.
output: The speed of sound is independent of the distance between the vibration source and the receiver. So the answer is (a).

input: Which scientist is credited with discovering the first four moons of Jupiter? (a) Galileo Galilei. (b) Albert Einstein. (c) Charles Darwin. (d) Sir Isaac Newton.
output: Galileo Galilei is credited with discovering the first four moons of Jupiter. So the answer is (a).

input: During science class, a teacher explains that the samples the students are studying are made of two or more minerals. What are the students studying? (a) gases. (b) rocks. (c) elements. (d) molecules.
output: The samples are made of two or more minerals, so the answer is (b).

input: When the Northern Hemisphere is tilted away from the Sun causing the rays of light to hit Earth at large angles, which season occurs? (a) winter. (b) spring. (c) summer. (d) fall.
output: When the Northern Hemisphere is tilted away from the Sun, the rays of light hit Earth at large angles, causing the winter season. So the answer is (a).

input: A scientist found fossils of ocean shells on a mountain top. Based on this find, which statement can be made? (a) The climate was once colder. (b) The shells were carried by the wind. (c) The mountain was covered by water. (d) The shells once lived on dry land.
output: The shells were carried by the wind. So the answer is (b).

input: A student sees many plants around a pond. The student can determine which plants are nonvascular by (a) observing if they lack true stems, roots, or leaves. (b) examining the plants for spores. (c) counting the number of leaves on each stalk. (d) noticing if the plants are near rocks.
output: Option (a) is the correct answer. Option (a) is the correct answer because nonvascular plants lack true stems, roots, or leaves. So the answer is (a).

input: Darryl learns that freezing temperatures may help cause weathering. Which statement explains how freezing temperatures most likely cause weathering? (a) by freezing the leaves on trees. (b) by causing rocks to stick together. (c) by turning acid rain into acid snow. (d) by freezing water in the cracks of rocks.
output: When water freezes, it expands. This expansion can cause rocks to crack and break. So the answer is (d).

input: A bond is formed when an electron is transferred from a sodium atom to a chlorine atom. What happens to the sodium atom during this process? (a) The mass of the atom increases. (b) The atom becomes an isotope. (c) The atomic number decreases. (d) The atom becomes a positive ion.
output: The electron is transferred from the sodium atom to the chlorine atom, so the sodium atom becomes a positive ion. So the answer is (d).

input: A group of fish was released into a local lake. This species of fish had never lived in the lake before. Scientists want to collect data on how the lake's ecosystem is affected by the new fish. Which method of data collection will give the most accurate results? (a) Measuring oxygen levels in the lake for two months. (b) Checking the lake water for nutrient levels on one day. (c) Sampling fish populations in the lake over several years. (d) Observing the surface of the lake for signs of the new fish after one week.
output: The best way to collect data on how the lake's ecosystem is affected by the new fish is to observe the surface of the lake for signs of the new fish after one week. So the answer is (d).

input: On a career day at school, an X-ray technician discusses her daily work with the class. Which equipment would she most likely say she uses on a regular basis to help ensure the safety of patients? (a) earplugs. (b) rubber gloves. (c) goggles. (d) lead aprons.
output: The answer is (d). X-ray technicians use lead aprons to help ensure the safety of patients. So the answer is (d).

input: In the United States, windmills have been used for farming for hundreds of years. Which simple machine is the most important part of a windmill? (a) lever. (b) pulley. (c) inclined plane. (d) wheel and axle.
output: The windmill is a combination of several simple machines, but the most important part is the wheel and axle. So the answer is (d).

input: Which tools are needed to measure the effects of friction on a block of wood? (a) meter stick, spring scale. (b) balance, stopwatch. (c) balance, meter stick. (d) meter stick, stopwatch.
output: The meter stick and the stopwatch are needed to measure the effects of friction on a block of wood. So the answer is (d).

input: Planets outside of our solar system have been detected. What suggested the presence of a planet outside of our solar system? (a) radio wave emissions. (b) a wobble in the rotation of the star. (c) regular occurring eclipses of its moons. (d) the discovery of a star as large as our own.
output: The discovery of a star as large as our own suggests the presence of a planet outside of our solar system. So the answer is (d).

input: During which process are pieces of rock material being moved over Earth's surface by water and wind? (a) conduction. (b) deposition. (c) erosion. (d) revolution.
output: During erosion, pieces of rock material are moved over Earth's surface by water and wind. So the answer is (c).

input: The Apollo 11 mission was able to retrieve samples of the Moon's surface because it was the first mission to have astronauts (a) land on the Moon. (b) orbit a planet. (c) return to Earth. (d) walk in space.
output: The Apollo 11 mission was the first mission to land on the Moon. So the answer is (a).

input: A student mixes a teaspoon of sugar in a large glass of water. What happens to the sugar when it is mixed with the water? (a) It boils. (b) It melts. (c) It dissolves. (d) It evaporates.
output: Sugar dissolves in water. So the answer is (c).

input: Particle accelerators, such as the Large Hadron Collider in Europe, accelerate subatomic particles to great speeds. These particles move in opposite directions at nearly the speed of light and collide into one another to simulate conditions that were present as the universe formed. Which property of matter in the initial moments of the universe are these accelerators designed to simulate? (a) low density. (b) high energy. (c) massive nuclei. (d) circular movement.
output: The property of matter in the initial moments of the universe is high energy. So the answer is (b).

input: A doorbell circuit converts electrical energy into mechanical energy. The mechanical energy is in the form of vibrations that ultimately produce (a) chemical energy. (b) thermal energy. (c) radiant energy. (d) sound energy.
output: The mechanical energy is in the form of vibrations that ultimately produce sound energy. So the answer is (d).

input: Which factor determines if two individuals are members of the same species? (a) They live in the same habitat and niche. (b) They forage and eat the same type of food. (c) They mate and produce fertile offspring. (d) They are similar in appearance and color.
output: The definition of a species is that two individuals are members of the same species if they can mate and produce fertile offspring. So the answer is (c).

input: Which of the following planets is always closer to the Sun than it is to Earth? (a) Jupiter. (b) Mercury. (c) Saturn. (d) Uranus.
output: Uranus is always closer to the Sun than it is to Earth. So the answer is (d).

input: Cells need nutrients for energy. Which system is responsible for breaking down food to provide cellular energy? (a) digestive. (b) excretory. (c) circulatory. (d) respiratory.
output: The digestive system is responsible for breaking down food to provide cellular energy. So the answer is (a).

input: During which activity should a student wear goggles? (a) writing a science report. (b) mixing baking soda with water. (c) measuring the length of a shadow. (d) examining a leaf with a microscope.
output: Option (b), mixing baking soda with water, is the only activity that requires the use of goggles. So the answer is (b).

input: Bacillus thuringiensis (Bt) is a soil bacterium that is toxic to certain insects. Genes from this bacterium have been inserted into cotton to make Bt cotton. Farmers that use Bt cotton would most likely use less of which of the following? (a) water. (b) fertilizer. (c) herbicide. (d) insecticide.
output: Bt cotton is toxic to certain insects, so farmers would use less insecticide. So the answer is (d).

input: A student examined a rock sample and described it as having particles of various colors that were 1 millimeter to 12 millimeters in size. The student was making (1) an inference. (2) a hypothesis. (3) a prediction. (4) an observation.
output: The student was making an observation. So the answer is (d).

input: What are genes composed of? (1) offspring. (2) DNA. (3) cells. (4) traits.
output: Genes are composed of DNA. So the answer is (b).

input: In a classroom demonstration, a teacher pours sulfuric acid on some granulated sugar in a beaker. The sugar turns yellow and then black. Smoke rises and a strong smell is released. This demonstration is an example of what kind of change? (a) chemical. (b) physical. (c) magnetic. (d) electric.
output: The demonstration is an example of a chemical change. So the answer is (a).

input: Marta studied different forms of energy. Which two types of energy travel in waves? (a) light and sound. (b) electrical and sound. (c) chemical and light. (d) chemical and electrical.
output: Light and sound travel in waves. So the answer is (a).

input: The tops of some mountains are sharp and pointed, while the tops of others are smooth and rounded. This difference was most likely caused by (a) rivers flooding along a coastal plain. (b) erosion and weathering. (c) earthquakes and waves. (d) rocks melted underground by lava.
output: The difference in the tops of mountains is caused by erosion and weathering. So the answer is (b).

input: A student suggests to the school board that they use a renewable energy source. The student suggests they use (a) coal. (b) wind. (c) wood. (d) natural gas.
output: Wind is a renewable energy source, so the answer is (b).

input: Solar radiation provides more heat near the equator than near the poles on Earth. The greatest amount of heat is moved away from the equator by (a) ocean currents. (b) aquatic plants. (c) surface winds. (d) tectonic plates.
output: The greatest amount of heat is moved away from the equator by ocean currents. So the answer is (a).

input: Which human activity will help conserve Earth's natural resources? (a) leaving the television on all day. (b) recycling plastic bottles. (c) cutting down trees. (d) burning trash in the yard.
output: Burning trash in the yard will not conserve Earth's natural resources. So the answer is (d).

input: Which characteristic helps some animals defend themselves against predators? (a) strong odor. (b) poor hearing. (c) weak eyesight. (d) shivering.
output: Shivering is a characteristic that helps some animals defend themselves against predators. So the answer is (d).

input: Most plants begin their life cycle as ___. (a) leaves. (b) flowers. (c) roots. (d) seeds.
output: Plants begin their life cycle as seeds. So the answer is (d).

input: Erin wants to make a strong, light chair. Which natural material should she use? (a) iron. (b) granite. (c) clay. (d) wood.
output: Wood is the most natural material that is strong and light. So the answer is (d).

input: Jonathon was studying bears. He found out that bears are born with some behaviors and learn others from their environment. Which behavior does a bear most likely inherit? (a) how to find food in garbage cans. (b) how to hibernate during the winter. (c) how to seek shelter in a hollow log. (d) how to live in human neighborhoods.
output: Bears are born with the ability to hibernate during the winter. So the answer is (b).

input: A group of the same species of fish swim together to increase an individual's (a) swimming speed. (b) body temperature. (c) chance of survival. (d) visibility to predators.
output: Fishes swim together to increase their chance of survival. So the answer is (c).

input: In the oxygen cycle, which group of organisms replenishes a large portion of the atmospheric oxygen supply? (a) mammals. (b) fungi. (c) insects. (d) plants.
output: Plants are the main source of oxygen in the atmosphere. So the answer is (d).

input: Some antibiotics used to treat infections in humans are also used to treat chickens, but some groups oppose this practice. The overuse of the antibiotics will most likely influence the natural selection of which type of organisms? (a) chickens that naturally make the antibiotics. (b) microbes that are resistant to the antibiotics. (c) microbes that are susceptible to the antibiotics. (d) chickens that are resistant to infection.
output: Option (b), microbes that are resistant to the antibiotics, will most likely be influenced by the overuse of antibiotics. So the answer is (b).

input: A student performs a lab investigation by measuring the average time it takes for a toy car to travel 10 meters. Why is it best to perform the experiment in three trials? (a) to form a good hypothesis. (b) to increase the accuracy of the results. (c) to make the results more significant. (d) to better explain the investigation to others.
output: The purpose of performing an experiment is to increase the accuracy of the results. So the answer is (b).

input: A scientist finds a metamorphic rock formation next to a magma chamber and determines that it was originally a sedimentary rock formation. He concludes that the temperature of the magma chamber caused the rock formation to become metamorphic. Which is another reliable explanation of how the rock formation was changed? (a) weight of heavy machinery moving over the rocks. (b) pressure on the rock formation inside Earth. (c) a sandstorm that caused the rocks to be eroded. (d) a quick burial of the rocks by tons of volcanic ash.
output: The answer is (b). The pressure of the magma chamber is the most likely cause for the rock formation to become metamorphic. So the answer is (b).

input: Earth orbiting the Sun causes (a) the changing of the seasons. (b) daily tidal cycles. (c) day to become night. (d) the phases of the Moon.
output: The Earth orbiting the Sun causes the phases of the Moon. So the answer is (d).

input: The cycle of night and day on Earth is a result of (a) the Moon revolving around Earth. (b) Earth revolving around the Sun. (c) the Moon rotating on its axis. (d) Earth rotating on its axis.
output: The cycle of night and day on Earth is a result of Earth revolving around the Sun. So the answer is (b).

input: Which of these traits is most influenced by environment? (a) weight. (b) hair color. (c) blood type. (d) handedness.
output: The answer is (b), hair color.

input: Which statement describes a characteristic of a gas that has a significant effect on the climates of both Earth and Venus? (a) Nitrogen is chemically inert. (b) Sodium vapor reflects solar energy. (c) Carbon dioxide traps solar energy. (d) Argon is unable to react with water.
output: Option (c), carbon dioxide traps solar energy, is the correct answer. So the answer is (c).

input: DNA technology has improved greatly in the last twenty years. Which task has been made easier by the development of DNA technology? (a) identifying genetic disorders. (b) determining the parts of an atom. (c) observing distant objects in space. (d) making very accurate measurements.
output: DNA technology has improved greatly in the last twenty years. It has made it easier to identify genetic disorders. So the answer is (a).

input: Which condition is necessary for metamorphic rocks to form? (a) constant weathering and erosion. (b) extreme pressure and heating. (c) rapid burial of sediments. (d) slow cooling of magma.
output: Option (b), extreme pressure and heating, is necessary for metamorphic rocks to form. So the answer is (b).

input: Which event helps to renew a resource? (a) A seed is planted from a tree. (b) An offshore rig pumps oil. (c) A car is filled with gasoline. (d) An office is heated with coal.
output: Option (a) is the only option that renews a resource. So the answer is (a).

input: Which part of a plant takes in water and nutrients from the soil? (a) root. (b) stem. (c) flower. (d) leaf.
output: The root is the part of a plant that takes in water and nutrients from the soil. So the answer is (a).

input: A certain type of hybrid car utilizes a braking system in which energy is recovered and stored in batteries. This is an example of which type of energy conversion? (a) kinetic energy converted to potential energy. (b) chemical energy converted to kinetic energy. (c) chemical energy converted to thermal energy. (d) thermal energy converted to potential energy.
output: The braking system converts the kinetic energy of the car into potential energy. So the answer is (a).

input: Clownfish take shelter in the tentacles of sea anemones and keep sea anemones clean. Which type of relationship does this represent? (a) parasitism. (b) commensalism. (c) mutualism. (d) neutralism.
output: Clownfish and sea anemones are in a mutualistic relationship. So the answer is (c).

input: Some animals have behaviors that help them find food when little is available. Which best describes an animal with this type of behavior? (a) a robin that builds a nest. (b) an owl that calls at night. (c) a duck that swims in water. (d) a goose that migrates in winter.
output: Option (b), an owl that calls at night, is the best description of an animal with this type of behavior. So the answer is (b).

input: Part of a student's experiment is to measure changes in wind speed several hours before a storm. What piece of equipment should the student use? (a) barometer. (b) hygrometer. (c) anemometer. (d) weather vane.
output: An anemometer is used to measure wind speed. So the answer is (c).

input: An organism is born with a genetic abnormality not present in any of its ancestors. This abnormality is most likely the result of (1) circulation. (2) competition. (3) mutation. (4) respiration.
output: Mutation is the only option that can cause a genetic abnormality. So the answer is (b).

input: The length of one day on Earth is determined by how long it takes (1) the Moon to revolve once. (2) the Moon to rotate once. (3) Earth to rotate once. (4) Earth to revolve once.
output: The length of one day on Earth is determined by how long it takes Earth to rotate once. So the answer is (4).

input: When a rock is placed in a graduated cylinder containing water, the height of the water will (a) decrease. (b) increase. (c) remain the same.
output: The rock will displace water, so the height of the water will increase. So the answer is (b).

input: A student heats the same amount of two different liquids over Bunsen burners. Each liquid is at room temperature when the student begins. If liquid 1 has a higher specific heat than liquid 2, then liquid 1 will (a) evaporate sooner. (b) take longer to increase in temperature. (c) condense over a longer period. (d) chemically break down at a faster rate.
output: Specific heat is the amount of heat required to raise the temperature of a substance by 1 degree Celsius. So the answer is (b).

input: Through which activity do animals get the carbon that is needed for their bodies? (a) eating. (b) breathing. (c) running. (d) sleeping.
output: Animals get the carbon that is needed for their bodies through eating. So the answer is (a).

input: Scientists have discovered organisms that thrive in hot water that is 90°C (194°F) and do not need sunlight or oxygen to live. Into which kingdom would the scientists classify these organisms? (a) Archaebacteria. (b) Fungi. (c) Plantae. (d) Protista.
output: The organisms thrive in hot water that is 90°C (194°F), so they are most likely to be Archaebacteria. So the answer is (a).

input: A cook touches a hot stove and quickly moves his hand away. What are the two primary body systems that work together to produce this response? (a) Integumentary and endocrine systems. (b) Muscular and respiratory systems. (c) Nervous and muscular systems. (d) Skeletal and nervous systems.
output: The nervous and muscular systems work together to produce this response. So the answer is (c).

input: Which statement correctly describes both gases and liquids? (a) Their shapes stay the same in any container. (b) Their shapes change when they are in different containers. (c) Their volumes stay the same in any container. (d) Their volumes change when they are in different containers.
output: Both gases and liquids have the same volume in any container. So the answer is (c).

input: When the soil is saturated, earthworms move to the top of the soil to obtain oxygen. This behavior is evidence of which biological concept in earthworms? (a) learned behavior. (b) migration instinct. (c) response to stimuli. (d) reproductive strategy.
output: The earthworms move to the top of the soil to obtain oxygen, which is a response to stimuli. So the answer is (c).

input: Which of the following is more likely to occur in a plant cell than in an animal cell? (a) synthesis of enzymes. (b) formation of cellulose. (c) breakdown of glucose. (d) active transport of ions.
output: Plant cells are more likely to form cellulose than animal cells. So the answer is (b).

input: Earth revolves around the sun. The amount of time needed for Earth to complete one revolution around the sun is approximately (a) 1 day. (b) 28 days. (c) 180 days. (d) 365 days.
output: The earth takes approximately 365 days to complete one revolution around the sun. So the answer is (d).

input: Excess nitrogen fertilizers sometimes drain into waterways that flow into the Chesapeake Bay. This nitrogen may cause algae blooms, which reduce dissolved oxygen in the water. How does nitrogen negatively affect the Chesapeake Bay? (a) fish births increase. (b) fish populations decrease. (c) sediment on the bottom of the bay decreases. (d) the rate of water runoff into the bay increases.
output: Option (b) is the correct answer. Excess nitrogen fertilizers may cause algae blooms, which reduce dissolved oxygen in the water. This will cause fish populations to decrease. So the answer is (b).

input: Mount Arenal, a volcano in Costa Rica, is erupting. Heat is being released during the eruption. What is the source of the heat? (a) The heat comes from the Sun. (b) The heat comes from pools of underground water. (c) The heat comes from deep within Earth. (d) The heat comes from decaying plants and animals.
output: The heat comes from deep within Earth. So the answer is (c).

input: Which statement describes how the umbilical cord supports a developing fetus? (a) It provides a protective barrier between the mother and the fetus. (b) It keeps the fetus inside the mother until birth. (c) It provides a navel when the baby is born. (d) It supplies oxygen and nutrients to the fetus.
output: The umbilical cord supplies oxygen and nutrients to the fetus. So the answer is (d).

input: Which two human body systems are most responsible for getting oxygen to cells? (a) digestive and skeletal. (b) skeletal and circulatory. (c) circulatory and respiratory. (d) respiratory and digestive.
output: The circulatory and respiratory systems are most responsible for getting oxygen to cells. So the answer is (c).

input: In their science classroom, Sam and Julia cross a heterozygous tall (Tt) pea plant with a homozygous short (tt) pea plant. What ratio represents the results Sam and Julia can expect? (a) 1 tall plant to 3 short plants. (b) 2 tall plants to 2 short plants. (c) 3 tall plants to 1 short plant. (d) 4 tall plants to 0 short plants.
output: The ratio of the tall plants to the short plants is 3:1. So the answer is (a).

input: When atmospheric carbon dioxide increases, some of the carbon dioxide dissolves in the ocean causing the ocean to become (a) warmer. (b) cooler. (c) more acidic. (d) more alkaline.
output: When atmospheric carbon dioxide increases, some of the carbon dioxide dissolves in the ocean causing the ocean to become more acidic. So the answer is (c).

input: Over time, dried lava from an old volcano is worn down and broken into small pieces. When these pieces pile up and are cemented together to form new rock, how would this new rock be classified? (a) magma. (b) igneous. (c) sedimentary. (d) metamorphic.
output: The new rock is formed from the old rock, so it is classified as metamorphic. So the answer is (d).

input: When potassium and bromine atoms form chemical bonds, which of these is produced? (a) an element. (b) a mixture. (c) a compound. (d) a new form of matter.
output: A compound is produced when potassium and bromine atoms form chemical bonds. So the answer is (c).

input: How often does Earth rotate on its axis? (a) once every 12 hours. (b) once every 24 hours. (c) once every month. (d) once every year.
output: Earth rotates on its axis once every 24 hours. So the answer is (b).

input: The elements that make up the atmosphere of Earth can be listed as percentages or can be shown in a graph. Which type of graph would best show this information? (a) a bar graph. (b) a pie chart. (c) a line graph. (d) a scatterplot.
output: A bar graph would best show this information. So the answer is (a).

input: Animals give off carbon dioxide that plants take in through leaves. What do plants give off as a result of photosynthesis that animals need to breathe? (a) heat. (b) oxygen. (c) protein. (d) water.
output: Plants give off oxygen as a result of photosynthesis that animals need to breathe. So the answer is (b).

input: Air is composed of many different substances. Which of the following components of air is a compound rather than an element? (a) Argon, Ar. (b) Oxygen, O2. (c) Water, H2O. (d) Nitrogen, N2.
output: Nitrogen is a compound, not an element. So the answer is (d).

input: Which factor is responsible for the presence of equatorial deserts? (a) global warming. (b) asteroid impacts. (c) tilt of the Earth's axis. (d) the solar activity cycle.
output: The tilt of the Earth's axis is responsible for the presence of equatorial deserts. So the answer is (c).

input: The ash borer moth looks similar to a wasp, but it does not have the ability to sting. This adaptation most likely helps the moth survive because (a) it makes food easier to find. (b) predators avoid the moth. (c) it aids in attracting a mate. (d) the moth blends in with its surroundings.
output: The moth blends in with its surroundings, so the answer is (d).

input: Which organ system communicates with cells in muscle tissue so that the muscles contract or relax, allowing the body to move? (a) circulatory system. (b) nervous system. (c) respiratory system. (d) excretory system.
output: The nervous system communicates with cells in muscle tissue so that the muscles contract or relax, allowing the body to move. So the answer is (b).

input: Which device produces mechanical energy? (a) a battery. (b) an electric motor. (c) a light bulb. (d) a solar cooker.
output: An electric motor produces mechanical energy. So the answer is (b).

input: A beach is formed when sediment is deposited along a shoreline. What would most likely happen if rivers that empty into the ocean were dammed? (a) Less sediment would be deposited along the shoreline. (b) Beaches would form from different materials. (c) Sand dunes would become smaller. (d) Deltas would become larger.
output: Rivers that empty into the ocean are the main source of sediment that forms beaches. If rivers are dammed, less sediment will be deposited along the shoreline. So the answer is (a).

input: Due to extreme pressure, the inner core of Earth is (a) solid. (b) liquid. (c) gas. (d) plasma.
output: The inner core of Earth is solid. So the answer is (a).

input: The speed and general direction of motion of a galaxy relative to the Earth can be determined by (a) measuring its red shift. (b) the gravity it exerts. (c) contrasting it against nearby stars. (d) observing its motion across the sky.
output: The speed and general direction of motion of a galaxy relative to the Earth can be determined by observing its motion across the sky. So the answer is (d).

input: What are the three common states of matter? (a) liquid, gas, vapor. (b) gas, liquid, fluid. (c) solid, gas, liquid. (d) solid, vapor, liquid.
output: The three common states of matter are solid, liquid, and gas. So the answer is (c).

input: What is the primary reason for breaking down food molecules? (a) to absorb water into a cell. (b) to provide energy for a cell. (c) to remove wastes from a cell. (d) to store materials in a cell.
output: The primary reason for breaking down food molecules is to provide energy for a cell. So the answer is (b).

input: Topsoil is considered to be most fertile when it has a (a) low pH level. (b) low sand content. (c) high organic matter level. (d) high parent rock material level.
output: Topsoil is considered to be most fertile when it has a high organic matter level. So the answer is (c).

input: When chemicals in the atmosphere dissolve in water droplets, they precipitate with the water and pollute water reservoirs on Earth. The pollutants enter the food chain when aquatic organisms absorb them. Which of these pollutants eventually contaminates fish after coal is burned? (a) lead. (b) arsenic. (c) mercury. (d) aluminum.
output: The answer is (c).

input: An atom has a mass of 24 and a nuclear charge of 12. Which statement about the atom is accurate? (a) It has twice as many protons as electrons. (b) It has twice as many neutrons as protons. (c) It has equal numbers of neutrons and protons. (d) It has equal numbers of nuclear particles and electrons.
output: The number of protons is equal to the number of electrons. So the answer is (c).

input: Which is an example of a renewable energy resource? (a) biomass. (b) coal. (c) gas. (d) oil.
output: Biomass is a renewable energy resource. So the answer is (a).

input: The compression of matter due to gravitational attraction increased as the protoplanets formed. What was a result of this compression within each protoplanet? (a) initiation of nuclear fusion. (b) increase in noble gas destabilization. (c) increase in thermal energy. (d) initiation of photosynthesis reactions.
output: The compression of matter due to gravitational attraction increased as the protoplanets formed. This compression caused the temperature to increase, which in turn caused the thermal energy to increase. So the answer is (c).

input: The construction of Hoover Dam on the Colorado River resulted in abundant freshwater and electrical power for the region. Which of these is a disadvantage of the construction of Hoover Dam? (a) an increase in flooding downstream. (b) an increase in regional humidity. (c) a decrease in the amount of river ecosystems. (d) a decrease in the amount of water for irrigation.
output: The construction of Hoover Dam on the Colorado River resulted in abundant freshwater and electrical power for the region. However, the construction of Hoover Dam also caused an increase in flooding downstream, a decrease in the amount of water for irrigation, and a decrease in the amount of river ecosystems. So the answer is (d).

input: If you place a thermometer into a glass of boiling water, what temperature should the thermometer read? (a) 32°C. (b) 100°C. (c) 200°C. (d) 212°C.
output: The boiling point of water is 100°C. So the answer is (b).

input: What characteristic of carbon [C] makes it essential to living organisms? (a) Carbon forms crystal structures under certain conditions. (b) Carbon can exist as a solid, liquid, or gas. (c) Carbon bonds in many ways with itself to form chains. (d) Carbon exists in radioactive forms.
output: Carbon bonds in many ways with itself to form chains. So the answer is (c).

input: Scientists found evidence of a fish that lived millions of years ago. The fish had features that were possibly used to move on land. This fish is now extinct. What scientific evidence did the scientists most likely find that confirmed the existence of this fish? (a) a fossil. (b) a description. (c) a photograph. (d) a cave drawing.
output: A fossil is the most likely evidence that scientists would find to confirm the existence of a fish that lived millions of years ago. So the answer is (a).

input: What is the smallest unit of a chemical compound that still has the properties of that compound? (a) a nucleus. (b) a molecule. (c) an element. (d) an atom.
output: An atom is the smallest unit of a chemical compound that still has the properties of that compound. So the answer is (d).

input: A student is investigating in which type of soil a plant will grow best. Which should the student measure to answer the question? (a) height of the plants. (b) weight of the soil. (c) amount of water used. (d) temperature of the room.
output: The student should measure the amount of water used to answer the question. So the answer is (c).

input: An animal has scales and uses only its lungs to exchange gases. What is the animal most likely to be classified as? (a) a fish. (b) a reptile. (c) a mammal. (d) an amphibian.
output: Option (a), fish, is the most likely answer. So the answer is (a).

input: How are igneous and sedimentary rocks similar? (a) They are both formed by erosion. (b) They are both formed from cooled lava. (c) Heat and pressure can turn them into lava. (d) Heat and pressure can turn them into metamorphic rock.
output: Both igneous and sedimentary rocks are formed by heat and pressure. So the answer is (c).

input: When both a dominant and recessive gene are present, which of the following is true? (a) The dominant trait will be visible. (b) The recessive trait will be visible. (c) Neither trait will be visible. (d) It cannot be predicted which trait will be visible.
output: When both a dominant and recessive gene are present, the dominant trait will be visible. So the answer is (a).

input: Squirrels in cold climates gather and store food for winter. The squirrels sometimes bury nuts and then do not return for them. These nuts can grow to become trees. This chain of events is an example of (a) predation. (b) seed distribution. (c) competition. (d) seed fossilization.
output: The chain of events is an example of seed distribution. So the answer is (b).

input: Kurt drinks frozen fruit juice from a small cup. He measures the amount of fruit juice in the cup. Which property is Kurt measuring? (a) density. (b) height. (c) temperature. (d) volume.
output: Kurt is measuring the volume of the fruit juice. So the answer is (d).

input: A simple machine that has a mechanical advantage equal to 1 would most likely be used to (a) decrease effort. (b) decrease work. (c) change direction. (d) change resistance.
output: A simple machine with a mechanical advantage of 1 would not change the effort or work, but would change the direction of the force. So the answer is (c).

input: Roberto is sliding down a plastic slide on the playground. After he reaches the ground, he feels a small electric shock when he touches a piece of metal. What has been built up on his body that causes the shock? (a) atoms. (b) electrons. (c) neutrons. (d) protons.
output: The charge on Roberto's body is caused by electrons. So the answer is (b).

input: Plants grow best in soils that are rich in which of the following? (a) grains of sand. (b) lumps of clay. (c) layers of gravel. (d) decaying plants and animals.
output: Decaying plants and animals are the best source of nutrients for plants. So the answer is (d).

input: The rate of acceleration of an object is determined by the mass of the object and (a) the initial velocity of the object. (b) the forces acting on the object. (c) the direction of movement of the object. (d) the change in kinetic energy of the object.
output: The rate of acceleration of an object is determined by the mass of the object and the forces acting on the object. So the answer is (b).

input: Some aquifers are composed of limestone and dolomite. Which process increases the open spaces of the aquifer formation? (a) wave action. (b) wind erosion. (c) tensional faulting. (d) chemical weathering.
output: Chemical weathering is the process that increases the open spaces of the aquifer formation. So the answer is (d).

input: Leather basketballs are made for indoor use on smooth surfaces. Rubber basketballs are made for use on many different surfaces. Which of the following properties of rubber makes it better than leather for use on many different surfaces? (a) Rubber is durable. (b) Rubber is lightweight. (c) Rubber is dark in color. (d) Rubber is quickly produced.
output: Rubber is durable, so it can be used on many different surfaces. So the answer is (b).

input: On a field trip in a wooded area, you see a small, strange object. You wonder whether it is a live animal. The best way to find out is to observe the object to see if it (a) has an odor. (b) has separate parts. (c) can make a noise and has a lifelike color. (d) carries out basic life functions.
output: The best way to find out if the object is a live animal is to observe if it carries out basic life functions. So the answer is (d).

input: Ethanol is a type of alcohol made from plants. Sugarcane and corn, which are both used in foods such as cereals and breads, are used to make ethanol. Burning ethanol provides a clean source of energy because the products of ethanol are water and carbon dioxide. Therefore, mixing ethanol with gasoline reduces harmful waste products. In the 1970s, many Brazilians drove cars with engines that used an ethanol gasoline mixture. This alternative fuel conserved the limited supply of gasoline available at that time. In the 1990s, gasoline became cheaper than ethanol, and Brazilians returned to driving more gasoline-fueled cars. Recently, Brazilians started driving more cars that use an ethanol-gasoline mixture. Ethanol is a good alternative fuel because it (a) reduces air pollution. (b) increases biodiversity. (c) reduces sound pollution. (d) increases ozone emissions.
output: Ethanol is a good alternative fuel because it reduces air pollution. So the answer is (a).

input: A whistle produces a sound because blowing air in the whistle causes (a) the whistle material to shake. (b) the air inside the whistle to vibrate. (c) the air to be absorbed by the whistle. (d) the air in the whistle to heat up and expand.
output: The air inside the whistle vibrates, which causes the sound. So the answer is (b).

input: Each year the Earth moves once around (a) Mars. (b) the Sun. (c) the Moon. (d) all the other planets.
output: The Earth moves once around the Sun each year. So the answer is (b).

input: According to Newton's first law of motion, what counteracts gravity to keep a satellite in orbit? (a) inertia. (b) energy. (c) friction. (d) magnetism.
output: According to Newton's first law of motion, an object in motion will stay in motion unless acted upon by an outside force. So the answer is (a).

input: How do plants get water and minerals? (a) absorbed from the soil though the roots. (b) absorbed from the soil through the stem. (c) absorbed from the air through the flowers. (d) absorbed from the air through the leaves.
output: Plants absorb water and minerals through their roots. So the answer is (a).

input: A cell's chromosomes contain (1) genes. (2) chlorophyll. (3) sperm. (4) eggs.
output: Genes are found in chromosomes, so the answer is (1).

input: Which of these events is an example of a change in climate? (a) Afternoon clouds form and block the sunlight. (b) A series of tornadoes occurs over a one-week period. (c) An overnight temperature drop causes frost to form. (d) The average amount of annual precipitation decreases.
output: Option (d) is an example of a change in climate. So the answer is (d).

input: Which object works best when reflecting light? (a) mirror. (b) camera. (c) binoculars. (d) eyeglasses.
output: A mirror is the best object to reflect light. So the answer is (a).

input: A wetland was drained to build a mall. Two years later, there were no more toads in that area. Why did the toads disappear? (a) The toads were destroyed by the construction equipment. (b) The toads died because toads cannot breathe out of water. (c) The toads were frightened and went into the woods. (d) The toads go their food from the wetland ecosystem.
output: The toads disappeared because they were frightened and went into the woods. So the answer is (c).

input: Which elements are found to the right of the zigzag line in the periodic table? (a) liquids. (b) metals. (c) metals and gases. (d) nonmetals and gases.
output: Elements to the right of the zigzag line are nonmetals and gases. So the answer is (d).

input: Miranda learned how the human body carries out life functions. Which is the most basic level of organization in the human body? (a) an organ. (b) a system. (c) a tissue. (d) a cell.
output: The most basic level of organization in the human body is a cell. So the answer is (d).

input: Pollutants, such as motor oil and gasoline, are sometimes leaked onto roads by vehicles. How do these pollutants most likely affect the environment? (a) Storms wash the pollutants into lakes and rivers. (b) Animals become sick from licking the pollutants on the road. (c) Animals get stuck in the pollutants when they cross the road. (d) Winds blow the pollutants to the side of the road and harm the soil.
output: Pollutants are harmful to the environment, so the answer is (d).

input: Which of the following objects is probably the most flexible? (a) a ceramic dish. (b) a wooden block. (c) a short steel rod. (d) a new rubber hose.
output: A rubber hose is the most flexible object. So the answer is (d).

input: A student practicing for the outdoor track team begins to sweat. To what stimulus is the body responding? (a) an increase in heart rate. (b) an increase in body temperature. (c) an increase in oxygen demand. (d) an increase in breathing rate.
output: The body is responding to an increase in body temperature. So the answer is (b).

input: What repeating cycle is responsible for the four seasons that occur on Earth? (a) rotation of the moon. (b) rotation of the Sun. (c) revolution of the sun in the galaxy. (d) revolution of the earth about the sun.
output: The seasons are caused by the revolution of the earth about the sun. So the answer is (d).

input: Which of these systems functions to protect and support vital organs? (a) digestive. (b) skeletal. (c) nervous. (d) excretory.
output: The excretory system functions to protect and support vital organs. So the answer is (d).

input: Which characteristic would best help a rabbit survive in snow? (a) short legs. (b) dim eyesight. (c) thick, white fur. (d) slow movement.
output: Thick, white fur would best help a rabbit survive in snow. So the answer is (c).

input: Scientists are studying a pond. Which property can the scientists measure to understand the amount of energy held by the lake water? (a) the depth of the lake. (b) the color of the water. (c) the volume of the lake. (d) the temperature of the water.
output: The property that can be measured to understand the amount of energy held by the lake water is the temperature of the water. So the answer is (d).

input: Russell wants to observe changes in nature over the next few months. What can a thermometer help Russell investigate? (a) rainfall amounts each week. (b) tiny organisms in pond water. (c) the high temperatures each day. (d) the amount of growth in a plant.
output: A thermometer can help Russell investigate the temperature of the environment. So the answer is (c).

input: The egg stage in the life cycle of a bird is most like which phase in the life cycle of certain types of flowers? (a) seed. (b) spore. (c) pollen. (d) immature flower.
output: The egg stage in the life cycle of a bird is most like the seed stage in the life cycle of certain types of flowers. So the answer is (a).

input: Peristalsis helps move nutrients through parts of the body by using wavelike contractions. In which system is the function used? (a) circulatory. (b) digestive. (c) endocrine. (d) nervous.
output: Peristalsis is a wavelike contraction that helps move nutrients through parts of the body. So the answer is (b).

input: Which is the best way to help prevent the flu from becoming a pandemic? (a) getting a vaccination. (b) taking antibiotics. (c) eating fruits and vegetables. (d) washing hands often.
output: Option (d) is the best way to prevent the flu from becoming a pandemic. So the answer is (d).

input: Which theory states that the universe originated as a single mass? (a) Big Bang. (b) Steady State. (c) Astronomical. (d) Catastrophism.
output: The Big Bang theory states that the universe originated as a single mass. So the answer is (a).

input: As two continental plates collide, the edges of the plates are crumpled and uplifted. Which of these landforms is most likely a result of this type of collision? (a) normal faults. (b) mountain ranges. (c) U-shaped valleys. (d) shield volcanoes.
output: The edges of the plates are crumpled and uplifted, so the answer is (b).

input: During a walk in the woods, Mandy finds a plant structure that had fallen onto the trail. Mandy can tell the object contained seeds, and thinks it came from a flowering plant instead of a conifer. How can she determine if the object came from a flowering plant? (a) by looking for seed coats on the seeds. (b) by looking for wing-like structures on the seeds. (c) by looking for fruit tissue around the seeds. (d) by looking for young sporophytes inside the seeds.
output: The seeds of flowering plants are enclosed in a fruit tissue, so the answer is (c).

input: The esophagus, stomach, and small intestine are parts of which body system? (a) nervous. (b) digestive. (c) respiratory. (d) muscular.
output: The digestive system is composed of the esophagus, stomach, and small intestine. So the answer is (b).

input: Which of the following is a chemical property of silver? (a) malleable. (b) white metal. (c) conductor of heat. (d) reacts with nitric acid.
output: Silver is a conductor of heat, so the answer is (c).

input: If the climate in an area changed over time to become very cold, which change would most likely help a species living there to survive? (a) a thicker neck and longer tail. (b) a larger mouth and stronger jaws. (c) an increase in fur and fat. (d) an increase in height and speed.
output: Option (c), an increase in fur and fat, will help a species to survive in a cold climate. So the answer is (c).

input: A broken bone heals through the process of (1) adaptation. (2) mutation. (3) cell division. (4) chemical digestion.
output: The process of healing a broken bone is through cell division. So the answer is (c).

input: Which is the best example of an object with kinetic energy? (a) a plate sitting on a table. (b) a bird perching in a tree. (c) a marble rolling down a ramp. (d) a dam holding back some water.
output: The best example of an object with kinetic energy is a marble rolling down a ramp. So the answer is (c).

input: Lions tend to prey on primary consumers like zebras and gazelles. If there were a sudden decline in a population of lions, which ecological imbalance would most likely occur in the habitat? (a) overgrazing. (b) eutrophication. (c) invasion by non-native species. (d) overproduction of greenhouse gases.
output: Option (a), overgrazing, is the most likely to occur. So the answer is (a).

input: Which of the following could help to reduce a home heating bill in winter? (a) replacing wood doors with aluminum doors. (b) using more insulation in the walls of the home. (c) removing thick rugs and heavy curtains in the home. (d) painting the roof of the home white to reflect light.
output: Option (b) is the best option to reduce a home heating bill in winter. So the answer is (b).

input: Elizabeth uses a specific type of whistle to call her dogs. The noise made by the whistle is heard by the dogs but cannot be heard by the human ear. Which statement best describes why humans cannot hear the sound made by the whistle? (a) The speed of the sound is too fast. (b) The amplitude of the sound is too low. (c) The frequency of the sound is too high. (d) The wavelength of the sound is too long.
output: The frequency of the sound is too high. So the answer is (c).

input: Use the information to answer the question. Over the last 150 years, the use of fossil fuels has increased, resulting in more carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. Some scientists think that these atmospheric gases will result in global warming. Scientists have recorded data on global temperature changes and have predicted possible changes in sea level that may affect Maryland residents. Which action helps reduce global warming? (a) developing highways. (b) driving large vehicles. (c) using renewable power sources. (d) using electricity from coal burning power plants.
output: Option (c), using renewable power sources, helps reduce global warming. So the answer is (c).

input: As members of a food web, humans are considered to be (a) producers. (b) consumers. (c) decomposers. (d) scavengers.
output: Humans are consumers, so the answer is (b).

input: Which of the following statements best describes the role of gravity in the formation of stars? (a) Gravity converts solid matter into gases and light energy. (b) Gravity causes gases and dust particles to condense into spheres. (c) Gravity cools gases and liquids until they become one solid mass. (d) Gravity pushes rocks and dust particles outward from a dense center.
output: Gravity causes gases and dust particles to condense into spheres. So the answer is (b).

input: What is the name of the process in which igneous, sedimentary, and metamorphic rocks are converted into one another in stages? (a) rock cycle. (b) erosion cycle. (c) magma cycle. (d) tectonic cycle.
output: The rock cycle is the process in which igneous, sedimentary, and metamorphic rocks are converted into one another in stages. So the answer is (a).

input: What is happening when rocks are broken down by both physical and chemical changes? (a) weathering. (b) deposition. (c) condensation. (d) decomposing.
output: Rocks are broken down by both physical and chemical changes. So the answer is (a).

input: In a laboratory procedure, students added sodium hydroxide crystals to a beaker of water and allowed the resulting solution to cool. Based on this information, which type of chemical process most likely occurred? (a) electrical. (b) energetic. (c) exothermic. (d) endothermic.

input: Students are attempting to make a doorbell ring using some wire and a battery. What is needed to make the bell ring? (a) friction. (b) gravity. (c) a convection current. (d) an electrical circuit.

input: Which concept was most likely modified due to the invention of the microscope? (a) size of subatomic particles. (b) composition of living things. (c) number of the moons of Jupiter. (d) formation of sedimentary rocks.

input: Which energy transformation occurs during active transport in a cell? (a) light energy -> chemical energy. (b) kinetic energy -> potential energy. (c) chemical energy -> mechanical energy. (d) mechanical energy -> electrical energy.

input: The nervous system consists of the brain, spinal cord, and nerves that run throughout the entire body. Which of these is one function of the nervous system? (a) supports body posture. (b) controls body functions. (c) supplies the blood with oxygen. (d) carries blood to and from the heart.

input: The biological selection of a particular allele for a trait to be passed to offspring has nothing do with the selection of the allele for another trait. input: Air pollution can influence a person's quality of life. Which best identifies the influence of air pollution? (a) It is a behavioral influence. (b) It is a genetic influence. (c) It is an environmental influence. (d) It is a dietary influence.

input: What information about stars can be learned by using a spectrometer? (a) chemical composition. (b) distance from Earth. (c) size. (d) speed.

input: Which is the function of the gallbladder? (a) store bile. (b) produce bile. (c) store digestive enzymes. (d) produce digestive enzymes.
