input: A teacher was discussing with the class that a bowling ball has more inertia than a basketball. Which physical property is most likely being compared? (a) area. (b) mass. (c) weight. (d) volume.
output: The physical property being compared is mass. So the answer is (b).

input: A dark colored wall becomes warm when the Sun is shining on it. After the Sun sets, a person standing a meter away can feel warmth from the wall. How does heat transfer from the wall to the person? (a) radiation. (b) conduction. (c) convection. (d) insulation.
output: The wall is warm because of the Sun's radiation. The person feels warmth from the wall because of the wall's radiation. So the answer is (a).

input: During exercise, the cardiovascular system works together with the respiratory system to (a) maintain blood pressure. (b) remove carbon dioxide. (c) produce red blood cells. (d) filter out waste products.
output: The cardiovascular system works together with the respiratory system to remove carbon dioxide. So the answer is (b).

input: How does flipping a switch turn on a light? (a) It creates a spark. (b) It breaks an electrical circuit. (c) It generates electricity. (d) It completes an electrical circuit.
output: When a switch is flipped, it completes an electrical circuit. So the answer is (d).

input: A ship has a satellite communication device to identify the ship's position at sea. For which of the following activities is this device most likely used? (a) control. (b) guidance. (c) propulsion. (d) suspension.
output: The device is used to identify the ship's position at sea, so the answer is (a).

input: The purpose of thorns on a plant is most likely to (a) help the plant to get moisture. (b) anchor the plant in the ground. (c) protect the plant from harm. (d) support the stems and branches.
output: Thorns are used to protect the plant from harm. So the answer is (c).

input: Which of the following is best classified as a nonrenewable resource? (a) Grass. (b) Aluminum. (c) Sunlight. (d) Oxygen.
output: Nonrenewable resources are those that cannot be replaced. Grass is a renewable resource because it can be replaced by replanting. So the answer is (b).

input: Which of these are the deepest parts of the ocean? (a) Continental shelves. (b) Continental slopes. (c) Ocean trenches. (d) Abyssal plains.
output: Ocean trenches are the deepest parts of the ocean. So the answer is (c).

input: Which human body system forms a barrier between internal body structures and the external environment? (a) nervous. (b) digestive. (c) circulatory. (d) integumentary.
output: The integumentary system forms a barrier between internal body structures and the external environment. So the answer is (d).

input: Decaying plants and animals are important to an ecosystem because they (a) cause disease in living organisms. (b) reduce soil erosion. (c) recycle oxygen to the air. (d) return nutrients to the soil.
output: Decaying plants and animals are important to an ecosystem because they return nutrients to the soil. So the answer is (d).

input: The area of a small ocean island is slowly shrinking. This is most likely the result of which occurrence? (a) plant growth. (b) beach erosion. (c) dissolving rock. (d) falling water.
output: The area of an island is shrinking due to erosion, so the answer is (b).

input: Which of these will most likely result from small meteoroids entering the atmosphere of Earth? (a) a decrease in air temperature. (b) the appearance of shooting stars. (c) an decrease in atmospheric ozone. (d) the appearance of the Northern Lights.
output: Option (b), the appearance of shooting stars, is the most likely result from small meteoroids entering the atmosphere of Earth. So the answer is (b).

input: A main advantage to organisms that reproduce sexually is (a) being able to conserve energy. (b) having large numbers of offspring. (c) greater genetic diversity. (d) longer life spans.
output: Option (c), greater genetic diversity, is the main advantage to organisms that reproduce sexually. So the answer is (c).

input: A pan containing hot water is left on the counter and becomes cool mainly due to (a) water molecules moving apart. (b) cold air penetrating the hot water. (c) heat from the water moving into the cooler air. (d) hot water reacting with the metal pan.
output: The water molecules are moving apart, so the answer is (a).

input: James placed a breath mint and a lump of toothpaste in a cup of water and let it sit overnight. Which statement best explains why the breath mint was gone the following morning, but the toothpaste was still at the bottom of the cup? (a) The breath mint was less soluble than the toothpaste. (b) The breath mint was more soluble than the toothpaste. (c) The breath mint had a lower density than the toothpaste. (d) The breath mint had a greater density than the toothpaste.
output: The breath mint was more soluble than the toothpaste. So the answer is (b).

input: Which is an inherited characteristic on a horse? (a) a long mane. (b) a steel shoe. (c) a missing tooth. (d) a bruised leg.
output: Inherited characteristics are characteristics that are passed on from parents to offspring. So the answer is (a).

input: Scientists classify matter into various groups. Which group is typically described by the characteristics listed below? • usually solid at room temperature • can be bent or changed in shape without breaking • show a shiny luster when scratched or polished (a) metals. (b) nonmetals. (c) elements. (d) compounds.
output: Option (a), metals, are usually solid at room temperature, can be bent or changed in shape without breaking, and show a shiny luster when scratched or polished. So the answer is (a).

input: Sound waves travel the fastest through dense materials. Through which of these would sound waves travel the SLOWEST? (a) air. (b) glass. (c) metal. (d) water.
output: Sound waves travel the fastest through dense materials, and the slowest through less dense materials. So the answer is (a).

input: A student dissolves a spoonful of sugar in a glass of water and makes a (a) solute. (b) solvent. (c) solution. (d) suspension.
output: A solution is a mixture of two or more substances that are dissolved in each other. So the answer is (c).

input: Many scientists are convinced that an increase of certain gases in the atmosphere is affecting global temperatures. What makes this hypothesis difficult to prove? (a) Trees absorb these gases. (b) Global temperatures are rising. (c) Many variables affect global temperatures. (d) Many human activities produce these gases.
output: The answer is (c). Many variables affect global temperatures, so it is difficult to prove that an increase of certain gases in the atmosphere is affecting global temperatures. So the answer is (c).

input: How can the rate of an infectious disease be drastically reduced? (a) by taking medication daily. (b) by preventing transmission between people. (c) by wearing clean clothing daily. (d) by performing dental hygiene three times each day.
output: Option (b) is the best answer. By preventing transmission between people, the rate of an infectious disease can be drastically reduced. So the answer is (b).

input: Which is needed to determine the amount of gravitational force between two objects? (a) weight and time. (b) distance and mass. (c) volume and mass. (d) area and weight.
output: The gravitational force between two objects is determined by the mass of the objects and the distance between them. So the answer is (b).

input: Which tool, when properly used, would best help a student classify a basket of apples into groups based on mass? (a) balance. (b) thermometer. (c) meter stick. (d) graduated cylinder.
output: A balance is used to measure mass, so the answer is (a).

input: Ice cubes are an example of which form of water? (a) Gas. (b) Liquid. (c) Solid. (d) Natural.
output: Ice cubes are an example of solid water. So the answer is (c).

input: Which explains how the epithelium offers protection to land-dwelling vertebrates? (a) Epithelium provides a rigid shell to prevent punctures. (b) Epithelium has capillaries to resist iron deficiency. (c) Epithelium insulates the vertebrate from hypothermia. (d) Epithelium prevents dehydration in vertebrates.
output: The epithelium provides a barrier to prevent dehydration. So the answer is (d).

input: Which is the most likely way a scientist collects data during an experiment? (a) calculator. (b) graphs. (c) observations. (d) computer.
output: Observations are the most likely way a scientist collects data during an experiment. So the answer is (c).

input: Which must be present in order for something to be classified as an organism? (a) nucleus. (b) organ. (c) cell. (d) organelle.
output: An organism is a living thing that is composed of one or more cells. So the answer is (c).

input: Which mineral is most likely to be found in all of the three major rock types known as metamorphic, igneous, and sedimentary? (a) halite. (b) quartz. (c) gypsum. (d) sulfur.
output: All three rock types are made up of minerals, so the answer is (a).

input: A student rubs her hands together on a cold winter day. The heat that warms her hands is produced by (a) friction. (b) gravity. (c) light. (d) magnetism.
output: The heat that warms her hands is produced by friction. So the answer is (a).

input: When ocean waters become too warm, some whales travel to colder water. This movement is an example of (a) nest building. (b) hunting. (c) migrating. (d) hibernating.
output: Migrating is the process of moving from one place to another. So the answer is (c).

input: Students visit an aquarium and watch how an octopus behaves in its tank. Which behavior did the octopus most likely learn from its aquarium environment? (a) waiting to be fed at the aquarium door. (b) catching food using its arms. (c) being more active at night. (d) hiding behind rocks.
output: The octopus most likely learned to hide behind rocks from its aquarium environment. So the answer is (d).

input: The main function of a fish's fins is to help the fish (a) reproduce. (b) see. (c) breathe. (d) move.
output: The main function of a fish's fins is to help the fish move. So the answer is (d).

input: Stars appear to be blue, white, yellow, and red, even without the aid of a telescope. What causes the different colors of the stars? (a) the surface temperature. (b) the distance from Earth. (c) the distance from the Sun. (d) the gases that compose the star.
output: The color of a star is determined by the gases that compose the star. So the answer is (d).

input: What keeps the planets in orbit around the Sun? (a) air resistance. (b) friction. (c) gravity. (d) magnetism.
output: Gravity is the force that keeps the planets in orbit around the Sun. So the answer is (c).

input: Use the information below to answer the question. Cotton is a plant product used to make fabric. Cotton is made of cellulose, a fiber not digestible by humans. Cellulose is composed of many sugar molecules bonded together into long chains. Each sugar molecule contains carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen atoms. When cotton fabric is washed, wrinkles often form. The clothing industry uses chemicals to manufacture some cotton fabrics that are wrinkle-free. Dyes are also added to color the cellulose fibers in cotton. A feature that is common to both cellulose and sugar is that both are (a) magnetic. (b) elements. (c) compounds. (d) soluble in water.
output: Cotton is a plant product used to make fabric. Cotton is made of cellulose, a fiber not digestible by humans. Cellulose is composed of many sugar molecules bonded together into long chains. Each sugar molecule contains carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen atoms. When cotton fabric is washed, wrinkles often form. The clothing industry uses chemicals to manufacture some cotton fabrics that are wrinkle-free. Dyes are also added to color the cellulose fibers in cotton. A feature that is common to both cellulose and sugar is that both are soluble in water. So the answer is (d).

input: Which animal is an example of an annelid? (a) an anteater. (b) a honey bee. (c) a sea star. (d) an earthworm.
output: An annelid is an animal with a segmented body. So the answer is (d).

input: What ALWAYS happens when the nucleotides in a strand of DNA is rearranged? (a) The information on the strand changes. (b) The mass of the strand changes. (c) The organism dies. (d) The organism thrives.
output: The information on the strand changes. So the answer is (a).

input: The surface of Earth is composed of large tectonic plates that are constantly shifting as they float on top of molten rock. Which process must occur in the mantle to make the plates move? (a) normal faulting. (b) seafloor spreading. (c) igneous intrusions. (d) convection currents.
output: Convection currents are the process that cause the plates to move. So the answer is (d).

input: Which set of tools would be best to use for dissecting in a biology lab? (a) pen, paper, and a computer. (b) scissors, forceps, and a scalpel. (c) petri dish, flask, and a Bunsen burner. (d) glass slides, dye, and a light microscope.
output: The answer is (c).

input: Which of these moves in a regular path around the Sun? (a) a planet. (b) a constellation. (c) a meteor. (d) a star.
output: A planet moves in a regular path around the Sun. So the answer is (a).

input: Which would best allow a species to survive environmental changes? (a) similar physical features. (b) low mutation rate. (c) small population. (d) genetic diversity.
output: Option (d), genetic diversity, is the best way for a species to survive environmental changes. So the answer is (d).

input: An electrical component that has a continuous path for electrons to flow is called (a) a closed circuit. (b) an open circuit. (c) a filament. (d) a battery.
output: A closed circuit is a continuous path for electrons to flow. So the answer is (a).

input: In certain areas, tectonic plates move over hot spots. Which landforms are most likely associated with these hot spots? (a) trenches. (b) volcanoes. (c) island arcs. (d) mid-ocean ridges.
output: Hot spots are associated with volcanoes, so the answer is (b).

input: Which tools are used to determine the boiling point of water? (a) hot plate and stopwatch. (b) thermometer and balance. (c) hot plate and thermometer. (d) balance and graduated cylinder.
output: The boiling point of water can be determined by using a thermometer and a hot plate. So the answer is (b).

input: A substance that carries sound waves is called (a) a fulcrum. (b) a medium. (c) a spectrum. (d) an equilibrium.
output: A medium is a substance that carries sound waves. So the answer is (b).

input: Which force causes a bicycle to slow down when the brakes are used? (a) friction. (b) electricity. (c) gravity. (d) magnetism.
output: Friction is the force that causes a bicycle to slow down when the brakes are used. So the answer is (a).

input: The ichthyornis was a type of bird that lived over 65 million years ago. It lived near the sea and hunted for fish over the water. Fossils have been found in Kansas, many miles from the present-day ocean. Which cause of extinction is most likely to be found in the fossil record along with ichthyornis fossils? (a) changes in the environment. (b) diseases causing illness. (c) changes in the weather. (d) predator animals.
output: Option (b), diseases causing illness, is the most likely cause of extinction. So the answer is (b).

input: Indigo buntings are birds that nest in Florida during the summer. Male buntings are bright blue in color while females are a dull brown. How does the dull brown color of the female buntings help the species survive? (a) It helps male birds find a mate. (b) It helps the birds find food more easily. (c) It helps hide the birds while they sit on their nests. (d) It helps the birds find the flock when migrating.
output: The dull brown color of the female buntings helps the species survive because it helps the birds find the flock when migrating. So the answer is (d).

input: Which of these things will dissolve in water? (a) iron filings. (b) wood chips. (c) sand. (d) sugar.
output: Sugar dissolves in water, so the answer is (d).

input: Students combined baking soda and vinegar to demonstrate a chemical reaction. What indicates that a chemical reaction occurred? (a) the formation of bubbles. (b) a reduction in total mass. (c) the disappearance of atoms. (d) an increase in the number of atoms.
output: The formation of bubbles indicates that a chemical reaction occurred. So the answer is (a).

input: The loudness of sound can be changed by (a) decreasing the pitch. (b) increasing the frequency. (c) increasing the amplitude. (d) decreasing the wavelength.
output: The loudness of sound is related to the amplitude of the sound wave. So the answer is (c).

input: A mineral sample is obtained from a box, and acid is dropped on the sample to determine if it bubbles. Which best describes what should be done with the mineral after testing it? (a) Return the mineral to its box. (b) Rinse the mineral with water, dry it, and return it to the box. (c) Wipe the mineral with a paper towel and return it to the box. (d) Put the mineral in the sink and leave it for the teacher to clean up.
output: The mineral should be returned to its box after testing. So the answer is (b).

input: At what temperature does water begin to boil? (a) 0°C. (b) 32°C. (c) 100°C. (d) 212°C.
output: Water begins to boil at 100°C. So the answer is (c).

input: Rosa and Ted ate granola bars before competing in a swimming competition. Less than 50% of the chemical energy in the granola bars was converted to mechanical energy during the swim competition. If all the energy in the granola bars was used, which most likely happened to the rest of the energy? (a) It was lost as potential energy. (b) It was lost as chemical energy. (c) It was converted to thermal energy. (d) It was converted to magnetic energy.
output: The chemical energy in the granola bars was converted to thermal energy. So the answer is (c).

input: What is the primary energy source driving circulation of ocean currents on Earth? (a) geothermal heating. (b) planetary rotation. (c) solar heating. (d) lunar tidal forces.
output: The primary energy source driving circulation of ocean currents on Earth is solar heating. So the answer is (c).

input: Which statement best explains why the force of a hurricane diminishes as the hurricane moves over land? (a) A high pressure area develops. (b) The sea level rises on the coast. (c) The winds start to spin clockwise. (d) The supply of warm, moist air decreases.
output: The supply of warm, moist air decreases. So the answer is (d).

input: n 1931, Barbara McClintock discovered that genes could change position on a chromosome. In corn plants, if a certain gene was moved next to the gene that controls kernel color, the kernels in an ear of corn were various colors. Which statement best supports McClintock's discovery? (a) Genes control inherited traits in organisms. (b) Corn plants can reproduce in laboratory environments. (c) Chromosomes can move around in the nucleus of a cell. (d) Genes are able to disappear and reappear in later generations.
output: Option (b) is the best answer. The discovery of the gene controlling kernel color in corn plants is the best evidence that genes control inherited traits in organisms. So the answer is (a).

input: The breaking of a mineral into small, flat sheets is known as (a) luster. (b) streak. (c) cleavage. (d) hardness.
output: Cleavage is the breaking of a mineral into small, flat sheets. So the answer is (c).

input: Which location on Earth receives the most direct sunlight? (a) the deserts. (b) the South Pole. (c) the equator. (d) the Western Hemisphere.
output: The equator receives the most direct sunlight. So the answer is (c).

input: All living things are made up of prokaryotic or eukaryotic cells. Which function is found in both prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells? (a) aerobic respiration. (b) sexual reproduction. (c) protein production. (d) nitrogen fixation.
output: All living things are made up of prokaryotic or eukaryotic cells. So the answer is (a).

input: Jamal lives in the Northern Hemisphere. Which season is it when the Northern Hemisphere is pointed away from the Sun? (a) fall. (b) spring. (c) summer. (d) winter.
output: The Northern Hemisphere is pointed away from the Sun during winter. So the answer is (d).

input: What is an energy change that takes place in a light bulb? (a) Chemical energy changes to light energy. (b) Chemical energy changes to heat energy. (c) Electrical energy changes to light energy. (d) Electrical energy changes to chemical energy.
output: Light energy is produced when electrical energy is changed to light energy. So the answer is (a).

input: When an electric fan is running, most of the incoming electrical energy changes into which kind of energy? (a) heat energy. (b) light energy. (c) mechanical energy. (d) sound energy.
output: Most of the incoming electrical energy changes into heat energy. So the answer is (a).

input: Which trait does a cactus seedling inherit from its parents? (a) the amount of water it absorbs. (b) the length of its spines. (c) the type of organism that pollinates its flowers. (d) the number of organisms that consume its fruit.
output: The trait of a cactus seedling is inherited from its parents, so the answer is (a).

input: The freezing point of nitrous oxide is -91°C. Which of the following statements best describes the effect on the particles in liquid nitrous oxide as its temperature is lowered to -91°C? (a) The speed of the particles decreases. (b) The particles begin to move in a straight line. (c) The particles begin to move with a greater force. (d) The motion of the particles becomes more random.
output: The freezing point of nitrous oxide is -91°C. When the temperature is lowered to -91°C, the particles will begin to move with a greater force. So the answer is (c).

input: Which of the following will absorb heat energy? (a) two sticks being rubbed together. (b) a piece of wood burning. (c) steel wool rusting. (d) ice cubes melting.
output: Option (d), ice cubes melting, will absorb heat energy. So the answer is (d).

input: Which behavior will best help a student stay healthy? (a) watching television five hours a day. (b) sleeping three hours each night. (c) eating fruits and vegetables each day. (d) exercising once a month.
output: Option (c), eating fruits and vegetables each day will help a student stay healthy. So the answer is (c).

input: Which of these includes Earth? (a) the asteroid belt. (b) the Andromeda Galaxy. (c) the solar system. (d) the Eagle Nebula.
output: The solar system includes Earth. So the answer is (c).

input: The vertical axis on a graph is the y-axis. What is most likely placed along the y-axis? (a) element symbols. (b) negative numbers. (c) dependent variables. (d) independent variables.
output: The y-axis is the vertical axis on a graph. It is used to plot dependent variables. So the answer is (c).

input: Monica learned that humans are born knowing how to do some things and they learn how to do other things. Which is a behavior humans learn? (a) blinking. (b) breathing. (c) crying. (d) swimming.
output: Humans are born knowing how to do some things and they learn how to do other things. So the answer is (b).

input: Which factor will cause a decrease in the force of attraction between two magnets? (a) increasing the size of the two magnets. (b) increasing the distance between the two magnets. (c) changing the color of the two magnets. (d) changing the texture of the two magnets.
output: The force of attraction between two magnets is directly proportional to the distance between the two magnets. So the answer is (b).

input: What event occurs because of the rotation of Earth? (a) tides. (b) four seasons. (c) night and day. (d) changes in the weather.
output: The rotation of Earth causes the change in the weather. So the answer is (d).

input: The identifying characteristic of an element is its number of (a) protons. (b) neutrons. (c) electrons. (d) orbitals.
output: The number of protons is the identifying characteristic of an element. So the answer is (a).

input: A species of wasp lays its eggs in the larva of another insect. The wasp is a parasite, and the larva is the host. What is the relationship between the parasite and the host? (a) Both the parasite and the host benefit. (b) Both the parasite and the host are harmed. (c) The parasite benefits and the host is harmed. (d) The parasite is harmed and the host benefits.
output: The relationship between the parasite and the host is that the parasite benefits and the host is harmed. So the answer is (c).

input: Which structural characteristic is present in a paramecium that is not present in an amoeba? (a) pellicle. (b) cell wall. (c) cytoplasm. (d) cytoskeleton.
output: Paramecium has a cytoskeleton, but amoeba does not. So the answer is (d).

input: The structures in the bodies of many organisms have levels of organization that help the body to carry out life processes. Which list correctly shows how these levels are organized from the simplest to the most complex? (a) tissue, cell, organ, organ system. (b) organ, cell, organ system, tissue. (c) cell, tissue, organ, organ system. (d) organ system, tissue, organ, cell.
output: The levels of organization are from the simplest to the most complex. So the answer is (a).

input: Which safety gear are most important to wear when working near an open flame? (a) lab apron and goggles. (b) sunglasses and thermal gloves. (c) rubber shoes and sunglasses. (d) thermal gloves and goggles.
output: The most important safety gear to wear when working near an open flame is thermal gloves and goggles. So the answer is (d).

input: Recycling is important to the environment because it (a) is a good way to earn money. (b) produces more carbon dioxide for plants. (c) decreases the amount of natural resources. (d) is a way of conserving nonrenewable resources.
output: Recycling is important to the environment because it decreases the amount of natural resources. So the answer is (d).

input: Jamil studied how the position of Earth around the Sun affects the energy available on Earth. Which best explains why a particular place on Earth receives more energy during summer months than winter months? (a) the tilt of Earth. (b) the rotation of Earth. (c) the distance between Earth and the Sun. (d) the amount of rays produced by the Sun.
output: The tilt of Earth is the reason why a particular place on Earth receives more energy during summer months than winter months. So the answer is (a).

input: Shale is a common sedimentary rock. Which of these was required to form shale? (a) evaporating. (b) condensing. (c) melting. (d) compacting.
output: Shale is formed by compacting of sediments. So the answer is (d).

input: In the water cycle, rain, snow, or sleet falling to the ground is a form of (a) precipitation. (b) condensation. (c) evaporation. (d) transpiration.
output: Rain, snow, or sleet falling to the ground is a form of precipitation. So the answer is (a).

input: Cells perform many different processes that an organism needs to survive and grow. Which is the main function of the process of cellular respiration? (a) the production of sugar. (b) the release of energy. (c) the formation of new proteins for the cell. (d) the removal of waste products from the cell.
output: The main function of cellular respiration is to release energy. So the answer is (b).

input: A student places soil in a plastic container to make a home for some worms. The student cuts holes in the top of the container because the worms need (a) space to move. (b) air to breathe. (c) sunlight to grow. (d) sound to communicate.
output: The worms need air to breathe, so the answer is (b).

input: If it is determined that the particles in one solid are arranged in a repeating pattern and the particles in another solid are arranged randomly, what must be true about the solids? (a) They are different substances. (b) They have the same weight. (c) They have the same densities. (d) They are different mixtures.
output: The particles in a solid are arranged in a repeating pattern, so the particles in the other solid must be arranged randomly. So the answer is (d).

input: When manned space exploration began, NASA used the gravity assist concept so that spacecraft could conserve fuel. Which statement explains why the gravity assist concept was useful for spacecraft to successfully travel and return to Earth? (a) It gave spacecraft a timed trajectory. (b) It ensured spacecraft would return home safely. (c) It was helpful in planning spacecraft trajectories. (d) It ensured spacecraft would avoid being pulled into the sun.
output: The gravity assist concept was useful for spacecraft to successfully travel and return to Earth because it ensured spacecraft would return home safely. So the answer is (b).

input: In which of the following organs is an acid produced? (a) esophagus. (b) large intestine. (c) small intestine. (d) stomach.
output: The stomach is the only organ that produces acid. So the answer is (d).

input: It took Stephen 12 seconds to run across a grass field. Which additional information does he need in order to calculate his acceleration during the run? (a) the direction he ran and the average speed. (b) the distance he ran and the average velocity. (c) the beginning speed and the direction he ran. (d) the beginning velocity and the ending velocity.
output: Stephen needs to know the beginning and ending velocity in order to calculate his acceleration. So the answer is (c).

input: What are two of Earth's natural resources? (a) nuclear power plants and batteries. (b) forests and nuclear power plants. (c) batteries and waterfalls. (d) forests and waterfalls.
output: Option (b) is correct. Forests and nuclear power plants are two of Earth's natural resources. So the answer is (b).

input: In New England, there are noticeable patterns of seasonal change. Which information could you collect to BEST illustrate this change? (a) air temperature. (b) wind speed. (c) amount of precipitation. (d) number of cloudy days.
output: Option (c), amount of precipitation, is the best indicator of seasonal change. So the answer is (c).

input: Volume and mass are properties of (a) friction. (b) light. (c) matter. (d) sound.
output: Volume and mass are properties of matter. So the answer is (c).

input: Which of the following do water (H2O), rust (Fe2O3), and salt (NaCl) have in common? (a) Water, rust, and salt are atoms. (b) Water, rust, and salt are mixtures. (c) Water, rust, and salt are elements. (d) Water, rust, and salt are compounds.
output: Water, rust, and salt are all compounds. So the answer is (d).

input: Which of these careers would a student studying biotechnology most likely pursue? (a) electrical engineering. (b) astronomy. (c) agricultural research. (d) geology.
output: Biotechnology is the study of living organisms and their parts. So the answer is (c).

input: The first person to introduce the idea of the continents moving around the surface of Earth was (a) Niels Bohr. (b) Albert Einstein. (c) Charles Darwin. (d) Alfred Wegener.
output: Alfred Wegener was the first person to introduce the idea of the continents moving around the surface of Earth. So the answer is (d).

input: The cells of organisms found in the phylum Porifera (sponges) are not organized into tissues. What structures are absent in organisms belonging to the phylum Porifera? (a) organelles. (b) cells. (c) genes. (d) organs.
output: Organs are absent in organisms belonging to the phylum Porifera. So the answer is (d).

input: A class wanted to see which paper airplane design could fly the farthest. In order to have the most accurate results, every student should (a) use the same size of paper. (b) buy the same color of paper. (c) fold the paper the same way. (d) decorate the paper the same way.
output: The students should use the same size of paper to have the most accurate results. So the answer is (a).

input: The following advertisement was placed in the window of a camping supply store. "The double-thermal 'Polar Snooze' sleeping bag is here! It will keep you warm for winter camping!" Based on this advertisement, the best conclusion about Polar Snooze sleeping bags is that they (a) are lightweight. (b) have insulation. (c) make winter camping easy. (d) cost less than other sleeping bags.
output: The advertisement is trying to sell the sleeping bags, so the best conclusion is that they cost less than other sleeping bags. So the answer is (d).

input: About how long does it take for Earth to make one revolution around the Sun? (a) one day. (b) one week. (c) one month. (d) one year.
output: The Earth takes one year to make one revolution around the Sun. So the answer is (d).

input: Twins are born. One is a boy and one is a girl. Which statement is correct about their genetic makeup? (a) The boy and girl inherit genetic material from the father only. (b) The boy and girl inherit genetic material from the mother only. (c) The boy and girl inherit genetic material from both parents. (d) The boy inherits genetic material from the father only and the girl inherits it from the mother only.
output: The boy and girl inherit genetic material from both parents. So the answer is (c).

input: Which particles are responsible for the electric charge of an atom? (a) protons and neutrons. (b) protons and electrons. (c) neutrons and molecules. (d) molecules and electrons.
output: The electrons are responsible for the electric charge of an atom. So the answer is (b).

input: Which is the best source of vitamins and minerals? (a) fruits and vegetables. (b) bread, rice, and pasta. (c) milk and milk products. (d) meat, fish, and poultry.
output: Fruits and vegetables are the best source of vitamins and minerals. So the answer is (a).

input: Copper wire is often wrapped in plastic. Plastic material is a good (a) electromagnet. (b) insulator. (c) circuit. (d) current.
output: Plastic is an insulator, so the answer is (b).

input: Teresa is making a list of the similarities and differences between a euglena and a volvox cell. In which way is the euglena different from the volvox cell? (a) A euglena can respond to light. (b) A euglena can live in fresh water. (c) A euglena can regulate water intake. (d) A euglena can only reproduce asexually.
output: A euglena can only reproduce asexually, while a volvox cell can reproduce both sexually and asexually. So the answer is (d).

input: If the body takes in more food than it uses. (a) breathing becomes faster. (b) weight is lost. (c) the heart rate increases. (d) the food is stored as fat.
output: The body takes in more food than it uses, the body will store the extra food as fat. So the answer is (d).

input: The mass of an object is measured using which unit? (a) liter. (b) gram. (c) meter. (d) yard.
output: The mass of an object is measured using the unit gram. So the answer is (b).

input: The Sun transforms matter into energy through nuclear fusion. What can be inferred about the Sun from this fact? (a) The Sun is losing mass and hydrogen. (b) The Sun is losing volume and hydrogen. (c) The Sun is losing mass and helium. (d) The Sun is losing volume and helium.
output: The Sun is losing mass and hydrogen. So the answer is (a).

input: Which job is done in Virginia only during the fall season? (a) Picking apples. (b) Feeding animals. (c) Selling clothes. (d) Building houses.
output: The job of picking apples is done in Virginia only during the fall season. So the answer is (a).

input: A scientist is studying the effect of acid rain on oak trees. Of the numbers below, which would be the number of oak trees the scientist should use to obtain the most reliable data? (a) 1. (b) 2. (c) 20. (d) 200.
output: The more oak trees the scientist uses, the more reliable the data will be. So the answer is (c).

input: Camouflage MOST helps an animal with which of these life needs? (a) Finding shelter. (b) Hiding from predators. (c) Gathering enough food. (d) Raising young.
output: Camouflage helps an animal to hide from predators. So the answer is (b).

input: There are a variety of events that can disrupt ecosystems. Some events result in local disturbances and others can affect a much larger area. Which event would most likely result in change on a global scale? (a) land scarred by forest fires. (b) erosion of ocean shorelines. (c) converging plate boundaries. (d) destruction of tropical rain forests.
output: The destruction of tropical rain forests will most likely result in change on a global scale. So the answer is (d).

input: A hardware designer finds that the wiring in a circuit is releasing enough heat to make the circuit dangerously hot. Which change would best solve this problem? (a) increasing the current in the circuit. (b) placing rubber insulation on wires in the circuit. (c) reversing the direction of current flow in the circuit. (d) using circuit wires with a lower resistance.
output: The circuit is releasing too much heat, so the best option is to use circuit wires with a lower resistance. So the answer is (d).

input: There are different kinds of muscles in the human body. Each muscle is formed from a group of cells that works together. The main function of a group of muscle cells is to (a) make oxygen. (b) release energy. (c) digest nutrients. (d) cause movement.
output: The main function of a group of muscle cells is to cause movement. So the answer is (d).

input: Four objects are on a wooden ramp. Which object is most likely to roll off the ramp if it is pushed gently? (a) flat eraser. (b) round ball. (c) bent paper clip. (d) wooden cube.
output: The object that is most likely to roll off the ramp is the round ball. So the answer is (b).

input: When zinc and copper are melted together, brass is formed. Brass is an example of (a) a solute. (b) an element. (c) a mineral. (d) a mixture.
output: Brass is a mixture of zinc and copper. So the answer is (d).

input: Choose the investigation that would best answer the question: Does the length of a string change how fast a pendulum swings? (a) Tie identical weights to two strings of different lengths. (b) Tie two different weights to a string. (c) Tie identical weights to a long string. (d) Tie two different weights to two identical strings.
output: Option (a) is the best option to answer the question. So the answer is (a).

input: Meiosis is necessary for which reproductive event to occur? (a) vegetative budding. (b) binary fission. (c) cloning. (d) fertilization.
output: Meiosis is necessary for fertilization to occur. So the answer is (d).

input: Some astronauts may spend several months in space orbiting Earth. Where do these astronauts most likely stay while in space? (a) on a space station. (b) in a space shuttle. (c) on a space probe. (d) in a lunar module.
output: Astronauts spend several months in space orbiting Earth on a space station. So the answer is (a).

input: Which is a possible consequence of global warming? (a) an increase in the amount of coral reefs. (b) a decrease in temperature, causing earlier frosts. (c) an increase in the number of heat waves, causing droughts. (d) a decrease in temperature, causing shorter growing seasons.
output: Global warming will cause an increase in the temperature of the earth, causing earlier frosts. So the answer is (b).

input: A brown bear eats a variety of foods including berries, insects, and small animals. Which best describes a brown bear? (a) producer. (b) herbivore. (c) carnivore. (d) omnivore.
output: A brown bear is an omnivore, which means it eats both plants and animals. So the answer is (d).

input: In which part of a plant cell does photosynthesis occur? (1) nucleus. (2) chloroplast. (3) cell membrane. (4) cell wall.
output: Photosynthesis occurs in the chloroplast. So the answer is (b).

input: Which alternative energy resource adds carbon dioxide to the atmosphere? (a) nuclear energy. (b) biofuel energy. (c) wind energy. (d) geothermal energy.
output: Biofuel energy is the only alternative energy resource that adds carbon dioxide to the atmosphere. So the answer is (b).

input: Energy from the Sun changes a liquid to a gas by the process of (a) condensation. (b) evaporation. (c) freezing. (d) melting.
output: Energy from the Sun changes a liquid to a gas by the process of evaporation. So the answer is (b).

input: Which of the following is a result of the tilt of Earth's axis? (a) seasonal changes. (b) hours in a day. (c) heights of tides. (d) moon phases.
output: The tilt of Earth's axis causes the seasons to change. So the answer is (a).

input: Chloroplasts absorb light energy. The function of the chloroplast is to (a) synthesize sugars. (b) synthesize proteins. (c) transform sugar into cellular energy. (d) transform proteins into useful nutrients.
output: The function of the chloroplast is to transform sugar into cellular energy. So the answer is (c).

input: When water changes from a liquid to a gas and then the steam condenses back to the liquid form, these types of changes are (a) physical. (b) chemical. (c) electrical. (d) mechanical.
output: The change of water from a liquid to a gas and then the steam condenses back to the liquid form is a physical change. So the answer is (a).

input: What direction is the movement of the energy in a food web? (a) consumer to producer. (b) producer to consumer. (c) decomposer to producer. (d) decomposer to consumer.
output: The movement of energy in a food web is from producer to consumer. So the answer is (a).

input: When the velocity of an ocean wave decreases as it approaches a shore, what happens to the wave? (a) Its height increases. (b) Its height decreases. (c) Its length shortens. (d) It crests.
output: When the velocity of an ocean wave decreases as it approaches a shore, the wave will crest. So the answer is (d).

input: Which is a force that keeps Earth in orbit around the Sun? (a) friction. (b) gravity. (c) radiation. (d) magnetism.
output: Gravity is the force that keeps Earth in orbit around the Sun. So the answer is (b).

input: Substances enter any plant or animal cell by passing through which of the following structures? (a) nucleus. (b) cell membrane. (c) vacuole. (d) chloroplast.
output: Substances enter any plant or animal cell by passing through the cell membrane. So the answer is (b).

input: Many years ago, purple dye was made from some sea animals. Then, in 1856, William Perkins tried to make a new medicine. Instead, he found a way to make purple dye from coal. What is a positive effect of his discovery? (a) Some diseases can be treated. (b) Purple clothing can be made. (c) Sea animals are not needed to make purple dye. (d) Perkins is famous for discovering a new medicine.
output: The answer is (b). Perkins discovered a new way to make purple dye, which is a positive effect. So the answer is (b).

input: When magnesium (Mg) metal is burned in the presence of oxygen (O?), magnesium oxide (MgO) is produced. The properties of magnesium oxide are different than the individual properties of magnesium and oxygen because magnesium oxide is (a) a solution. (b) a mixture. (c) a compound. (d) an element.
output: Magnesium oxide is a compound, so the answer is (c).

input: Fossils of sea animals were found in a cave in Arkansas. What does this mean about that area of Arkansas in the past? (a) It was once underwater. (b) It was once much warmer. (c) It has become a rockier place. (d) It has changed little from then.
output: The fossils of sea animals were found in a cave in Arkansas. This means that the area of Arkansas was once underwater. So the answer is (a).

input: Which instrument would be best for measuring the volume of a pebble? (a) metric ruler. (b) stopwatch. (c) triple beam balance. (d) graduated cylinder.
output: A graduated cylinder is used to measure the volume of a pebble. So the answer is (d).

input: Which of these is a waste product of plant cells? (a) minerals. (b) oxygen. (c) heat. (d) water.
output: Plants produce oxygen as a waste product. So the answer is (b).

input: It can take millions of years for fossil fuels to form. These fossil fuels form underground from decaying plants and animals. Which term best describes a fossil fuel? (a) a source of solar power. (b) a source of electrical power. (c) a source of renewable energy. (d) a source of nonrenewable energy.
output: Fossil fuels are nonrenewable energy sources. So the answer is (d).

input: Earth's hydrosphere is best described as the (1) relatively thin layer of rock found above Earth's mantle. (2) relatively thin layer of water covering most of Earth's crust. (3) hot liquid rock located in Earth's outer core. (4) very dense rock located in Earth's inner core.
output: The hydrosphere is the relatively thin layer of water covering most of Earth's crust. So the answer is (b).

input: When riding a roller coaster, an electric motor pulls the roller coaster to the top of the first hill. What force pulls the roller coaster down the hill? (a) friction. (b) speed. (c) gravity. (d) mass.
output: Gravity is the force that pulls the roller coaster down the hill. So the answer is (c).

input: Which of these organisms is classified as a decomposer? (a) hawk. (b) mushroom. (c) mouse. (d) grass.
output: A decomposer is an organism that breaks down dead organisms. So the answer is (b).

input: A cold-blooded vertebrate with smooth skin belongs to what class of animals? (a) reptile. (b) fish. (c) amphibian. (d) mammal.
output: Cold-blooded vertebrates with smooth skin belong to the reptile class. So the answer is (a).

input: Which of these best describes a tornado? (a) A winter storm that produces frozen precipitation. (b) A rotating funnel-shaped cloud with strong winds and thunderstorms. (c) A severe weather condition with low temperatures and blowing snow. (d) A storm that forms over warm ocean water and has extremely strong winds.
output: A tornado is a rotating funnel-shaped cloud with strong winds and thunderstorms. So the answer is (b).

input: Plants use carbon dioxide from the atmosphere during the process of (a) respiration. (b) fertilization. (c) evaporation. (d) photosynthesis.
output: Plants use carbon dioxide from the atmosphere during the process of photosynthesis. So the answer is (d).

input: A reverse fault occurs when one side of a fault plane is driven up over the other side. Reverse faults can cause which of these landforms? (a) deltas. (b) mountains. (c) dunes. (d) islands.
output: Reverse faults can cause mountains. So the answer is (b).

input: A student is collecting water samples. The student needs a container that holds water, will not break easily, and can be used many times. Which of the following containers will best meet the student's needs? (a) a glass jar. (b) a paper cup. (c) a wooden box. (d) a plastic bottle.
output: A plastic bottle is the best choice because it is made of plastic, which is a durable material. So the answer is (d).

input: What condition is most likely to spread an illness between people? (a) a virus suspended in the air. (b) an accident on a playground. (c) a genetic mutation in somatic cells. (d) an occurrence of acid rain.
output: Option (a), a virus suspended in the air, is the most likely condition to spread an illness between people. So the answer is (a).

input: When scientists proposed the Theory of Continental Drift, there were many skeptics. Which discovery confirmed that the continents move on plates? (a) deep-sea currents. (b) earthquake formation. (c) spreading of the sea floor. (d) sedimentary rocks.
output: The discovery of spreading of the sea floor confirmed that the continents move on plates. So the answer is (c).

input: Which two things are produced when a plant breaks down sugar to release energy? (a) carbon dioxide and water. (b) oxygen and carbon dioxide. (c) carbon dioxide and food. (d) oxygen and food.
output: Plants break down sugar to release energy, and the products are carbon dioxide and water. So the answer is (a).

input: A scientist wants to track contaminant movement in the Gulf Stream. The Gulf Stream is a warm water current in the North Atlantic Ocean and is part of the North Atlantic gyre. The gyre is influenced by the Coriolis effect. To follow the contaminant after it exits the Gulf Stream, the scientist needs to know characteristics of the North Atlantic gyre. Which of these best describes a movement of the North Atlantic gyre the scientist needs to know? (a) linear movement due west. (b) linear movement due south. (c) clockwise movement. (d) counterclockwise movement.
output: The North Atlantic gyre is a counterclockwise movement. So the answer is (d).

input: The growing human population has many practices that adversely impact the environment. Acid rain is one example of environmental damage that is related to human activities. Which human activity is most likely the largest contributor to acid rain? (a) burning fossil fuels in power plants. (b) using pesticides on agricultural crops. (c) dumping waste matter into ocean waters. (d) clearing native forests for industrialization.
output: Burning fossil fuels in power plants is the largest contributor to acid rain. So the answer is (a).

input: What happens to the water vapor in an air mass as it ascends? (a) It freezes. (b) It condenses. (c) It vaporizes. (d) It polarizes.
output: The water vapor in an air mass will condense as it ascends. So the answer is (b).

input: Which two terms are used to describe weather? (a) wind direction and amount of erosion. (b) gravity and amount of rain. (c) groundwater and cloud cover. (d) air temperature and wind speed.
output: Wind direction and amount of erosion are used to describe weather. So the answer is (a).

input: In what unit of time does Earth orbit the Sun? (a) day. (b) month. (c) year. (d) century.
output: The Earth orbits the Sun in a year. So the answer is (c).

input: While conducting an experiment on gravity, what will be needed to ensure the safety of students? (a) quiet zones. (b) drop zones. (c) heavy objects. (d) frictionless surfaces.
output: The answer is (b). Drop zones are needed to ensure the safety of students.

input: All of the populations of species in an area make up a (a) region. (b) niche. (c) family. (d) community.
output: A community is a group of populations of species in an area. So the answer is (d).

input: Cell division is necessary for an organism to (a) obtain nutrients. (b) grow and reproduce. (c) make proteins. (d) conserve matter and energy.
output: Cell division is necessary for an organism to grow and reproduce. So the answer is (b).

input: A large plant population may impose selective pressure on a smaller, isolated group of plants, resulting in a change in allele distribution. Which mechanism is responsible for this change in the allele distribution? (a) mutation. (b) hybridization. (c) genetic drift. (d) trait acquisition.
output: The mechanism responsible for this change in allele distribution is genetic drift. So the answer is (c).

input: Two samples of gold must have the same (a) mass. (b) volume. (c) length. (d) density.
output: The two samples of gold must have the same density. So the answer is (d).

input: A student organizes a list of the distances that five students ran in 10 minutes. Another way to best organize this data is by using a (a) pie graph. (b) bar graph. (c) line graph. (d) pictograph.
output: A line graph is the best way to organize the data. So the answer is (c).

input: What is the dependent variable in this experiment? (a) type of soil used. (b) amount of water used. (c) length of sunlight exposure. (d) growth of the bean plants.
output: The dependent variable is the growth of the bean plants. So the answer is (d).

input: Electricity is produced in a hydroelectric plant when moving water turns a turbine. Which describes this energy transformation from the turning turbine to electricity? (a) kinetic energy into electric energy. (b) nuclear energy into electric energy. (c) thermal energy into electric energy. (d) chemical energy into electric energy.
output: The energy transformation from the turning turbine to electricity is from kinetic energy into electric energy. So the answer is (a).

input: When a star explodes, an intensely bright object is formed. What is the name of this object? (a) nova. (b) red giant. (c) supernova. (d) white dwarf.
output: When a star explodes, a supernova is formed. So the answer is (c).

input: The Earth's equator receives more direct sunlight than the regions to its north and south. This distribution of sunlight accounts directly for which phenomenon? (a) The westward deflection of equatorial winds. (b) The movement of rising air currents away from the equator. (c) The rotation of storm systems. (d) The formation of calm "eyes" in the centers of cyclones.
output: The westward deflection of equatorial winds is caused by the uneven heating of the Earth's surface. So the answer is (a).

input: The class puts the planters by the window so that the plants can get more sunlight. How do the tomato plants use sunlight? (a) to make sugar in the leaves. (b) to use starch from the stems. (c) to move water to the flowers. (d) to get nutrients through the roots.
output: The plants use sunlight to get nutrients through the roots. So the answer is (d).

input: Which of these is the most serious impact to an ecosystem after a tornado? (a) an increase in biodiversity. (b) soil erosion along with water pollution. (c) the growth of plants in newly cleared areas. (d) animals relocating to different habitats.
output: The most serious impact to an ecosystem after a tornado is the growth of plants in newly cleared areas. So the answer is (c).

input: Gravity is responsible for the ___. (a) orbits of the planets around the Sun. (b) rotation of a planet on its axis. (c) tilt of Earth's axis. (d) phases of the Moon.
output: Gravity is responsible for the orbits of the planets around the Sun. So the answer is (a).

input: Some runners ate pasta before a race. The pasta was broken down into simple sugars and was absorbed by the blood stream. What body system was responsible for breaking down the pasta into small nutrients for use in the cells of the runners? (a) the nervous system. (b) the digestive system. (c) the excretory system. (d) the endocrine system.
output: The digestive system is responsible for breaking down the pasta into small nutrients for use in the cells of the runners. So the answer is (b).

input: Which crustal feature forms when two continental plates collide? (a) trenches. (b) rift zones. (c) tidal zones. (d) mountain ranges.
output: Mountain ranges are formed when two continental plates collide. So the answer is (d).

input: At which location does the movement of tectonic plates form isolated volcanic islands, such as Hawaii? (a) transform boundary. (b) divergent boundary. (c) subduction zone. (d) hot spot.
output: The movement of tectonic plates at a divergent boundary forms isolated volcanic islands, such as Hawaii. So the answer is (b).

input: Which current property of our solar system is mainly due to solar emissions occurring soon after the initiation of fusion in the Sun's core? (a) directions of revolution of the planets. (b) directions of rotation of the planets. (c) distribution of moons among the planets. (d) distribution of elements among the planets.
output: The current property of our solar system is the distribution of elements among the planets. So the answer is (d).

input: Water puddles on a sidewalk evaporate when the Sun heats the water. Which of these best describes what is happening as the water evaporates? (a) Water changes phase as it releases heat to the environment. (b) Water boils as it absorbs energy from the sidewalk. (c) Water becomes a gas as it absorbs energy from the Sun. (d) Water evaporates as its thermal energy is transferred to the air.
output: The water evaporates as its thermal energy is transferred to the air. So the answer is (d).

input: Clara says that her school is in a desert. Which fact about her schoolyard most helps her claim? (a) The schoolyard has few trees. (b) The schoolyard has rocks and sand. (c) The schoolyard gets warm in the summer. (d) The schoolyard gets little rain during the year.
output: The schoolyard is in a desert, so it gets little rain during the year. So the answer is (d).

input: What process is most responsible for the extinction of most species of plants and animals that have lived on Earth? (a) gene mutation. (b) environmental changes. (c) selective breeding. (d) decrease in reproduction.
output: The process of extinction is caused by environmental changes. So the answer is (b).

input: The scientific method is the inquiry process by which scientists raise and attempt to answer new questions. Which is the best way to communicate findings that result from scientific inquiry? (a) discuss the findings with scientists who agree with you. (b) discuss the findings with a well-known scientist. (c) publish the findings in scientific journals. (d) publish the findings in local newspapers.
output: The best way to communicate findings that result from scientific inquiry is to publish the findings in scientific journals. So the answer is (c).

input: Trevor turns on a lamp. When the lamp is on, electrical energy changes into which other form of energy? (a) chemical. (b) light. (c) mechanical. (d) potential.
output: When a lamp is turned on, electrical energy changes into light energy. So the answer is (b).

input: People often wear sunglasses in polar regions because most of the sunlight that strikes a snow-covered surface is (1) reflected. (2) absorbed. (3) refracted. (4) transmitted.
output: The answer is (b).

input: A plant is discolored and has large brown blotches on its leaves. This condition is most likely caused by (a) pollination. (b) photosynthesis. (c) nourishment. (d) disease.
output: Disease is the most likely cause for a plant to be discolored and have large brown blotches on its leaves. So the answer is (d).

input: Which is a characteristic of sedimentary rock? (a) forms in layers. (b) looks very shiny. (c) contains crystals. (d) forms from magma.
output: Sedimentary rock forms in layers, so the answer is (a).

input: Which gas is transported by the circulatory system in humans and is used by cells during respiration to release energy stored in food? (1) carbon dioxide. (2) nitrogen. (3) hydrogen. (4) oxygen.
output: Option (4), oxygen is transported by the circulatory system in humans and is used by cells during respiration to release energy stored in food. So the answer is (4).

input: Which of the following planets has the shortest orbit around the Sun? (a) Earth. (b) Mars. (c) Mercury. (d) Venus.
output: Mercury has the shortest orbit around the Sun. So the answer is (c).

input: Rivers leave behind small pieces of rocks after they flood. These small pieces of rock form a floodplain. Which words best describe a floodplain? (a) flat lands. (b) many sinkholes. (c) rugged peaks. (d) long rows of ridges.
output: A floodplain is a flat land that is formed by a river. So the answer is (a).

input: Some scientists believe that the mass extinction of dinosaurs was caused by the impact of a large meteorite on Earth. This impact would have caused a darkening of the sky due to dust blown into the upper atmosphere. This darkening would have reduced the sizes of some ecosystems because of (a) longer seasons. (b) accelerated erosion. (c) reduced photosynthesis. (d) increased number of hurricanes.
output: The answer is (c). The impact of a large meteorite would have caused a darkening of the sky due to dust blown into the upper atmosphere. This darkening would have reduced the sizes of some ecosystems because of reduced photosynthesis. So the answer is (c).

input: Which material is the best conductor of electricity? (a) metal. (b) glass. (c) wood. (d) plastic.
output: Metal is the best conductor of electricity. So the answer is (a).

input: Which is an example of a nonliving thing? (a) bird. (b) insect. (c) dog. (d) water.
output: Water is a nonliving thing. So the answer is (d).

input: What is a characteristic of sedimentary rock? (a) high hardness. (b) glassy texture. (c) contains fossils. (d) shiny silver luster.
output: Sedimentary rock is formed by the deposition of sediments, which are small particles of rock, on the surface of the Earth. So the answer is (c).

input: Rock that is made of material that has settled to the bottom of lakes and oceans and been compressed and hardened is (a) conglomerate rock. (b) volcanic rock. (c) sedimentary rock. (d) metamorphic rock.
output: Sedimentary rock is made of material that has settled to the bottom of lakes and oceans and been compressed and hardened. So the answer is (c).

input: Which are caused by the Coriolis Effect? (a) tornadoes. (b) volcanoes. (c) wind patterns. (d) stationary fronts.
output: The Coriolis Effect is the cause of wind patterns. So the answer is (c).

input: Which of the following compounds is most likely to be part of living organisms? (a) C?H??O?. (b) BF?. (c) MoCl?. (d) CsI.
output: Living organisms are made up of carbon, hydrogen, oxygen, nitrogen, and phosphorus. So the answer is (a).

input: The Sun produces energy through (a) chemical reactions. (b) fission of uranium. (c) nuclear fusion. (d) volcanic eruptions.
output: The Sun produces energy through nuclear fusion. So the answer is (c).

input: Which device is used to determine the volume of a liquid? (a) anemometer. (b) graduated cylinder. (c) test tube. (d) thermometer.
output: A graduated cylinder is used to determine the volume of a liquid. So the answer is (b).

input: Mrs. Garry's class wants to know if their area has more acid rain than other parts of the state. Which would be the best way for them to begin research? (a) contact other schools within the state. (b) study science textbooks in the library. (c) look for current acid rain studies on the Internet. (d) examine soil samples taken at different locations.
output: Option (c) is the best way for them to begin research. So the answer is (c).

input: Which illustrates the correct order of relationships in organisms? (a) tissue -> organ system -> organ -> cell. (b) organ -> cell -> organ system -> tissue. (c) cell -> tissue -> organ -> organ system. (d) organ system -> organ -> cell -> tissue.
output: The correct order of relationships in organisms is tissue -> organ system -> organ -> cell. So the answer is (a).

input: Which is evidence that the universe is expanding? (a) the presence of dark matter. (b) red shift of light from distant galaxies. (c) constant speed of light from every perspective. (d) emission of high-energy gamma rays by distant objects.
output: The universe is expanding because the distance between galaxies is increasing. So the answer is (b).

input: Which of these statements is true about the parts that make up the atom? (a) Protons are larger than neutrons. (b) Electrons have a positive charge. (c) Electrons are inside the nucleus. (d) Neutrons have no charge.
output: Option (b) is true. So the answer is (b).

input: A certain fossil (Y) is found in a layer of rock that lies between two index fossils, X and Z. Surprisingly, the older of the index fossils (Z) is found above the other fossils, suggesting that the rock layer has overturned. Which dating method is best to confirm the rock layer has overturned by determining the ages of these fossils? (a) anatomical comparison. (b) gene sequencing. (c) radiometric analysis. (d) fossil depth measurement.
output: The fossils are found in a rock layer, so the best dating method is radiometric analysis. So the answer is (c).

input: Which items would be most useful at home during a power failure? (a) flashlights and extra batteries. (b) hats and sunscreen. (c) raincoats and umbrellas. (d) insect spray and jackets.
output: Flashlights and extra batteries are most useful during a power failure. So the answer is (a).

input: Energy flows in an ecosystem through food webs. Which form of energy is the least available for reuse in a food web? (a) heat energy. (b) sunlight energy. (c) energy from producers. (d) energy from consumers.
output: Energy from consumers is the least available for reuse in a food web. So the answer is (d).

input: Which of the following fasteners are best to use to fasten the sides of a wooden birdhouse? (a) bolts. (b) hooks. (c) nails. (d) pins.
output: Bolts are the best fasteners to use to fasten the sides of a wooden birdhouse. So the answer is (a).

input: In areas where a lot of earthquakes occur, architects are designing buildings with the ability to move with the land. How are the new building designs most likely to help people? (a) The new designs can help save lives. (b) The new designs are more attractive. (c) The new designs cost less to make. (d) The new designs are much taller.
output: The new designs are more likely to help people survive earthquakes. So the answer is (a).

input: In which form is most of the energy released from gasoline when burned by an automobile? (a) heat energy. (b) nuclear energy. (c) solar energy. (d) sound energy.
output: The energy released from gasoline when burned is in the form of heat energy. So the answer is (a).

input: Heart disease can result in a reduced amount of oxygen moving properly through the body. Which body system does heart disease most directly affect? (a) skeletal. (b) excretory. (c) circulatory. (d) nervous.
output: The heart is a part of the circulatory system, so the answer is (c).

input: The oil used today is made from the ancient remains of tiny sea creatures called "Diatoms." When they were alive, the Diatoms converted sunlight into stored energy. Based on this information, which of the following statements is true? (a) The Sun turned diatoms into oil after 10-20 years. (b) Diatoms are the original source of energy for oil. (c) The Sun is the original source of energy for oil. (d) Diatoms converted oil into energy.
output: The Sun is the original source of energy for oil. So the answer is (c).

input: Skunks spray a strong-smelling liquid to ___. (a) get rid of wastes. (b) attract prey. (c) defend themselves. (d) help nearby plants grow.
output: Skunks spray a strong-smelling liquid to defend themselves. So the answer is (c).

input: Which is an example of mechanical weathering? (a) a rockslide. (b) a volcano erupting. (c) an earthquake occurring. (d) a rock freezing and thawing.
output: Rock freezing and thawing is an example of mechanical weathering. So the answer is (d).

input: Recycling newspapers is good for the environment because it (a) increases the need for trees. (b) helps conserve resources. (c) increases the need for landfills. (d) helps remove pollutants from the air.
output: Recycling newspapers is good for the environment because it helps conserve resources. So the answer is (b).

input: Rocks and minerals are common materials found on Earth. Which property do most rocks and minerals share? (a) They are pure. (b) They are solid. (c) They are liquid. (d) They are magnetic.
output: Most rocks and minerals are solid. So the answer is (b).

input: Which organs belong to the lymphatic system? (a) lungs, trachea. (b) spleen, thymus. (c) kidneys, bladder. (d) pancreas, pituitary gland.
output: The lymphatic system is a network of organs and tissues that produce and transport lymph. So the answer is (b).

input: The hardness, odor, and taste of an object can all be (a) measured with a metric ruler. (b) measured with a spring scale. (c) observed with the senses. (d) observed with a hand lens.
output: The hardness, odor, and taste of an object can all be observed with the senses. So the answer is (c).

input: A bird called a ptarmigan has feathered feet. The feathers on the feet of the ptarmigan are most helpful when this bird ___. (a) digs up food. (b) walks in deep snow. (c) climbs rocky cliffs. (d) runs under bushes.
output: The feathers on the feet of the ptarmigan are most helpful when this bird walks in deep snow. So the answer is (b).

input: What is responsible for changing the remains of prehistoric sea animals into natural gas? (a) time. (b) water. (c) gravity. (d) pressure.
output: The remains of prehistoric sea animals are changed into natural gas by pressure. So the answer is (d).

input: Which is a basic structure found in all living organisms? (a) cell. (b) organ. (c) compound. (d) element.
output: All living organisms are made up of cells, so the answer is (a).

input: To calculate the relative age of rocks, geologists use the rate of radioactive decay of isotopes present in their samples. What is the term used for the original amount of the elemental isotopes being investigated? (a) rare earth isotopes. (b) son isotopes. (c) daughter isotopes. (d) parent isotopes.
output: The term used for the original amount of the elemental isotopes being investigated is parent isotopes. So the answer is (d).

input: An echo is a sound wave that has been (a) absorbed. (b) refracted. (c) scattered. (d) reflected.
output: An echo is a sound wave that has been reflected. So the answer is (d).

input: The central nervous system consists of two parts: the brain and the (a) senses. (b) organs. (c) muscles. (d) spinal cord.
output: The central nervous system consists of the brain and the spinal cord. So the answer is (d).

input: A small town is building their first water treatment plant. Their primary disinfectant is UV radiation. Which contaminant will UV radiation eliminate? (a) bacteria. (b) metals. (c) sediment. (d) oil.
output: UV radiation will eliminate bacteria. So the answer is (a).

input: Which of the following must be included with magnitude to represent a vector? (a) mass. (b) direction. (c) acceleration. (d) volume.
output: A vector is a quantity that has both magnitude and direction. So the answer is (b).

input: What does a fire take away from a forest that squirrels need to survive? (a) food and soil. (b) food and shelter. (c) water and soil. (d) water and shelter.
output: A fire takes away food and shelter from squirrels. So the answer is (b).

input: Nitrogen, a nutrient found in fertilizer, helps plants increase in size. Rainwater runoff often carries fertilizer into ponds and lakes. What effect does excess nitrogen have on organisms in a pond or lake ecosystem? (a) Algae grows rapidly. (b) Mutations occur gradually in fish. (c) Clam shells are slowly weakened. (d) Frogs adapt quickly to new food sources.
output: Excess nitrogen causes algae to grow rapidly. So the answer is (a).

input: Which measurement is the most accurate way to describe the distance between the Sun and its nearest neighboring star? (a) 4 light-years. (b) 400 light-years. (c) 4 billion kilometers. (d) 400 billion kilometers.
output: The nearest neighboring star is Proxima Centauri, which is 4.24 light-years away from the Sun. So the answer is (a).

input: Which four elements make up most of the human body? (a) oxygen, carbon, hydrogen, nitrogen. (b) silicon, calcium, oxygen, aluminum. (c) carbon, sodium, hydrogen, oxygen. (d) sulfur, phosphorous, calcium, nitrogen.
output: The four elements that make up most of the human body are oxygen, carbon, hydrogen, and nitrogen. So the answer is (a).

input: An area is semiarid, has few trees, and is home to ground-nesting birds. This area is most likely part of which biome? (a) tundra. (b) taiga. (c) grassland. (d) desert.
output: Option (d), desert, is the most likely biome for an area that is semiarid, has few trees, and is home to ground-nesting birds. So the answer is (d).

input: Which organisms make energy available to all other organisms in a food chain? (a) producers. (b) decomposers. (c) consumers. (d) scavengers.
output: Producers are organisms that make energy available to all other organisms in a food chain. So the answer is (a).

input: Which of these substances is correctly identified as a mineral? (a) coal. (b) quartz. (c) granite. (d) sandstone.
output: Quartz is a mineral, so the answer is (b).

input: Two objects are at rest and are 1.0 meter apart. To reduce the gravitational pull between the two objects, they should be (a) stacked vertically. (b) placed side by side. (c) moved 0.5 meter apart. (d) moved 1.5 meters apart.
output: The gravitational pull between two objects is inversely proportional to the square of the distance between the two objects. So the answer is (d).

input: Soil color is closely related to its content. Which element causes soil to appear red? (a) iron. (b) silicon. (c) calcium. (d) magnesium.
output: Iron is the element that causes soil to appear red. So the answer is (a).

input: Which particles make up the mass of an atom? (a) protons and neutrons. (b) protons and electrons. (c) neutrons and molecules. (d) electrons and molecules.
output: The mass of an atom is made up of protons and neutrons. So the answer is (a).

input: Auroras occur where Earth's magnetosphere traps high-energy particles in which region of the atmosphere? (a) troposphere. (b) stratosphere. (c) thermosphere. (d) exosphere.
output: Auroras occur in the ionosphere, which is part of the thermosphere. So the answer is (c).

input: An experiment was performed at sea-level. 400 mL of water was put in 4 different-shaped containers and placed on hot plates with 4 different temperature settings as shown below. Beaker - 110°C Petri dish - 95°C Erlenmeyer flask - 60°C Round bottom bowl - 45°C Which characteristic of water remained the same in each container? (a) the shape of the water. (b) the rate of evaporation. (c) the boiling point of water. (d) the amount of steam released per minute.
output: The characteristic of water that remained the same in each container is the boiling point of water. So the answer is (c).

input: In plants, what is responsible for passing traits from one generation to the next? (a) chloroplasts. (b) photosynthesis. (c) roots. (d) genes.
output: Genes are responsible for passing traits from one generation to the next. So the answer is (d).

input: Which safety measure should a student take when handling a microscope? (a) clean the lenses with your fingers. (b) keep switching the magnifications. (c) carry the microscope with two hands at all times. (d) make sure to put the microscope on an uneven surface.
output: Option (c) is the best safety measure to take when handling a microscope. So the answer is (c).

input: Which statement best describes the size of the Sun? (a) The Sun is medium-sized compared to other stars. (b) The Sun is the largest and brightest star in the universe. (c) Most of the stars in the universe would fit inside the Sun. (d) Most of the stars in the universe are smaller than the Sun.
output: The Sun is the largest and brightest star in the universe. So the answer is (b).

input: A wetland was drained to build a mall. Two years later, there were no more toads in that area. Why did the toads disappear? (a) The toads were destroyed by the construction equipment. (b) The toads died because toads cannot breathe out of water. (c) The toads were frightened and went into the woods. (d) The toads got their food from the wetland ecosystem.
output: The toads disappeared because they were frightened and went into the woods. So the answer is (c).

input: Technological advances are allowing scientists to develop methods for replacing abnormal human genes with healthy copies of the same genes. Which is the most likely use for this gene therapy? (a) killing viruses. (b) healing wounds. (c) treatment of airborne infections. (d) treatment of inherited diseases.
output: Gene therapy is used to treat inherited diseases. So the answer is (d).

input: Which statement about plant and animal cells is true? (a) Both have a cell wall to give them support. (b) Both have a large vacuole to store water. (c) Both use mitochondria to produce energy. (d) Both use chloroplasts to store energy.
output: Both plant and animal cells have a cell wall to give them support. So the answer is (a).

input: Finding fossils of warm-weather plants in the rock layers of a cold northern island suggests that (a) the plants used to be harvested for food. (b) the island used to be located farther south. (c) the climate of the island used to be warmer. (d) the fossils used to be more resistant to cold.
output: The fossils of warm-weather plants in the rock layers of a cold northern island suggests that the island used to be located farther south. So the answer is (b).

input: The hereditary material in corn plants can be altered by scientists so the plants produce more corn. Which term identifies this process? (1) environmental degradation. (2) ecological succession. (3) natural selection. (4) genetic engineering.
output: The term genetic engineering is used to describe the process of altering the hereditary material in corn plants. So the answer is (4).

input: What is the main function of red blood cells? (a) To fight disease in the body. (b) To carry oxygen to all parts of the body. (c) To remove carbon monoxide from all parts of the body. (d) To produce materials which cause the blood to clot.
output: Red blood cells carry oxygen to all parts of the body. So the answer is (b).

input: Earthquakes and volcanic eruptions occur both on land and in water. Earthquakes and volcanic eruptions most often occur (a) near plate boundaries. (b) on large pieces of land. (c) in large bodies of water. (d) in regions near the equator.
output: Earthquakes and volcanic eruptions occur near plate boundaries, so the answer is (a).

input: An earthworm has a length of 12.8 centimeters. What is the length, in millimeters, of the earthworm? (a) 0.128 millimeter. (b) 1.28 millimeters. (c) 128 millimeters. (d) 1280 millimeters.
output: The length of the earthworm is 12.8 centimeters, so the length in millimeters is 12.8 x 10-3 millimeters. So the answer is (b).

input: Which material has the least resistance to the flow of electricity? (a) rubber. (b) aluminum. (c) granite. (d) wood.
output: The material with the least resistance to the flow of electricity is wood. So the answer is (d).

input: Which are replenished more quickly than they are used? (a) energy resources. (b) material resources. (c) renewable resources. (d) nonrenewable resources.
output: Energy resources are replenished more quickly than they are used. So the answer is (a).

input: What is the first thing a student should do before starting an experiment? (a) read all the directions. (b) find a lab partner. (c) make notes about observations. (d) write a report on the investigation.
output: The first thing a student should do before starting an experiment is to read all the directions. So the answer is (a).

input: Which of the following parts of the human body is most complex? (a) heart. (b) kidney. (c) white blood cell. (d) central nervous system.
output: The central nervous system is the most complex part of the human body. So the answer is (d).

input: The Wright Brothers' invention has had the greatest impact on (a) transportation. (b) communication. (c) mass production. (d) space exploration.
output: The Wright Brothers' invention has had the greatest impact on transportation. So the answer is (a).

input: Which best describes how earthworms improve soil as they eat dead plant material? (a) They make the soil clean. (b) They keep disease out of the soil. (c) They recycle nutrients into the soil. (d) They remove extra water from the soil.
output: Earthworms recycle nutrients into the soil. So the answer is (c).
