input: Which of these has been controlled in an attempt to reduce the depletion of ozone in Earth's atmosphere? (a) methods of filtering gasoline. (b) use of chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs). (c) methods of radioactive waste storage. (d) use of mercury (Hg) compounds.
output: The use of CFCs has been controlled in an attempt to reduce the depletion of ozone in Earth's atmosphere. So the answer is (b).

input: Today's limestone caverns were once solid rock. Acidic rainwater seeping through the rock over hundreds of years dissolved part of the rock, forming caverns. This is an example of (a) erosion. (b) deposition. (c) physical weathering. (d) chemical weathering.
output: Limestone caverns are formed by chemical weathering, so the answer is (d).

input: Which of the following contains most of the water on Earth? (a) the oceans. (b) watersheds. (c) the atmosphere. (d) ice and aquifers.
output: The oceans contain most of the water on Earth. So the answer is (a).

input: Which substance do all living things require to survive? (1) blood. (2) water. (3) carbon dioxide. (4) organic soil.
output: All living things require water to survive. So the answer is (b).

input: A student plans to measure the thermal expansion of a strip of metal as it is heated from 0ºC to 50ºC. Which piece of equipment should he use to measure the expansion? (a) a ruler. (b) a balance. (c) a compass. (d) a protractor.
output: A ruler is used to measure the length of an object, so the answer is (a).

input: Which of these was used by Alfred Wegener as evidence that Earth's continental landmasses had drifted apart over time? (a) the age of the continents. (b) the shape of the continents. (c) the thickness of the continents. (d) the composition of the continents.
output: The age of the continents is the most likely evidence that Alfred Wegener used to support his theory. So the answer is (a).

input: The driver of a car at a railroad crossing hears a change in pitch of the train whistle as the train passes by. This change in pitch is most likely due to (a) the Doppler effect. (b) the Compton effect. (c) a change in medium. (d) a change in speed.
output: The Doppler effect is the change in frequency of a sound wave due to the motion of the source or the observer. So the answer is (a).

input: Which is an example of a hypothesis? (a) Large mice will eat more food than smaller mice. (b) One flower was measured to be 13 centimeters tall. (c) On a dark night, a student counted hundreds of stars. (d) People should be careful to protect endangered animals.
output: A hypothesis is a statement that is not yet proven. So the answer is (d).

input: Which would be considered an inexhaustible resource? (a) oil. (b) topsoil. (c) sunlight. (d) aluminum.
output: Option (a), oil is an inexhaustible resource. So the answer is (a).

input: Which factor causes surface ocean currents? (a) the Sun. (b) the wind. (c) the Moon. (d) hurricanes.
output: Surface ocean currents are caused by the wind. So the answer is (b).

input: Marta has a radio in her room. It requires electricity in order to play. Which of the following is necessary in order for electricity to move from the source to the radio? (a) a circuit. (b) a magnet. (c) a light bulb. (d) an insulator.
output: A circuit is necessary for electricity to move from the source to the radio. So the answer is (a).

input: Having dry, hot weather for a long time can cause a (a) drought. (b) thunderstorm. (c) tornado. (d) flood.
output: Drought is caused by a lack of rain, so the answer is (a).

input: What is the primary function of white blood cells in humans? (a) carry oxygen. (b) fight disease. (c) grow tissues. (d) remove waste.
output: White blood cells fight disease, so the answer is (b).

input: Which trait most likely helps an animal survive in a very cold environment? (a) long ears. (b) large eyes. (c) thick fur. (d) sharp claws.
output: Option (c), thick fur is the most likely trait that helps an animal survive in a very cold environment. So the answer is (c).

input: Which is most likely a genetic adaptation of desert plants to survive the hot, dry climate conditions? (a) thin bark. (b) waxy leaves. (c) leaves that remain all year. (d) flowers that bloom all year.
output: Option (b), waxy leaves, is the most likely genetic adaptation of desert plants to survive the hot, dry climate conditions. So the answer is (b).

input: Charles Darwin made a number of observations and inferences during his travels. He studied island finches during a long period of time. Which statement is an inference? (a) Individual birds have different colored feathers. (b) Island finches have a large number of offspring. (c) Individual birds of an island finch species have many differences. (d) Island finches share a common ancestry with mainland finch species.
output: The statement (d) is an inference. So the answer is (d).

input: A student mixes salt and water in a beaker to form a solution. What properties of the substances would allow the student to then separate the components? (a) densities. (b) particle sizes. (c) boiling points. (d) electrical conductivity.
output: The student can separate the components by using the property of boiling point. So the answer is (c).

input: In a lab investigation, students had to identify different mineral specimens. Which property is the most reliable for identifying one mineral from another? (a) texture. (b) hardness. (c) crystal shape. (d) surface color.
output: Texture is the most reliable property for identifying one mineral from another. So the answer is (a).

input: Which of these revolves around a planet? (a) an asteroid. (b) a star. (c) a comet. (d) a moon.
output: A moon revolves around a planet. So the answer is (d).

input: A scientist wants to collect several bird eggs on an island. She needs a case that will protect the eggs she collects. Which of the following cases would best protect the eggs? (a) a hard metal case with flexible foam lining. (b) a flexible metal case with smooth plastic lining. (c) a strong wooden case with lightweight plastic lining. (d) a lightweight wooden case with strong aluminum lining.
output: The answer is (a). The hard metal case with flexible foam lining will protect the eggs the best.

input: Which process is a cause of variation in a species? (1) metamorphosis. (2) cellular respiration. (3) sexual reproduction. (4) regulation.
output: The process of variation is caused by sexual reproduction. So the answer is (b).

input: The leaves of a tree change color in the fall. This is an example of a tree (a) completing its life cycle. (b) preparing for migration. (c) responding to its environment. (d) beginning hibernation.
output: The leaves of a tree change color in the fall. This is an example of a tree responding to its environment. So the answer is (c).

input: A dog growls when a predator gets close. Growling is an example of which animal behavior? (a) migration. (b) hibernation. (c) communication. (d) germination.
output: Communication is the most likely answer. So the answer is (c).

input: In what respect are protons and electrons always equal? (a) mass number. (b) kinetic energy. (c) sign of charge. (d) magnitude of charge.
output: Protons and electrons are equal in magnitude of charge. So the answer is (d).

input: How does the Sun help move water from the ocean through the water cycle? (a) by causing surface water to evaporate. (b) by adding particles to the water. (c) by increasing the amount of water. (d) by blowing water toward land.
output: The Sun causes surface water to evaporate, which is the first step in the water cycle. So the answer is (a).

input: What would a model of the Sun, Earth, and Moon best help students visualize? (a) the phases of the Moon. (b) the effects of gravitation. (c) the effects of volcanic eruptions. (d) the consequences of earthquakes.
output: The model of the Sun, Earth, and Moon would best help students visualize the phases of the Moon. So the answer is (a).

input: How are bacterial cells and human cells alike? (a) They allow oxygen through the cell wall. (b) They allow carbon dioxide through the cell wall. (c) They allow nutrients through the cell membrane. (d) They allow nutrients through the nuclear membrane.
output: Bacterial cells and human cells are alike in that they allow nutrients through the cell membrane. So the answer is (c).

input: The Moon's surface is visible to an observer on Earth because the Moon (1) reflects sunlight. (2) absorbs light from Earth. (3) produces its own light. (4) transmits sunlight.
output: The Moon's surface is visible to an observer on Earth because the Moon (1) reflects sunlight. So the answer is (1).

input: Why do trees like oaks and walnuts depend upon squirrels? (a) to control population size. (b) to pollinate their flowers. (c) to remove dead wood. (d) to aid in seed distribution.
output: Trees like oaks and walnuts depend upon squirrels to aid in seed distribution. So the answer is (d).

input: When an atom gains an electron, the atom will (a) lose a proton. (b) reduce its mass. (c) become radioactive. (d) have a negative charge.
output: When an atom gains an electron, it will have a negative charge. So the answer is (d).

input: A paramecium is an example of (a) a single-celled organism. (b) multiple organisms. (c) an inorganic substance. (d) a group of cells.
output: A paramecium is a single-celled organism. So the answer is (a).

input: A sea anemone uses poisonous darts to (a) absorb food. (b) defend itself. (c) attract a mate. (d) protect its young.
output: The function of the poisonous darts is to defend itself. So the answer is (b).

input: Rivers and streams can carry sediments long distances before they are deposited. What is formed when sediments are deposited at the mouth of a river? (a) a levee. (b) a gully. (c) a delta. (d) a rift.
output: Sediments are deposited at the mouth of a river to form a delta. So the answer is (c).

input: Steel is used for cables in suspension bridges because of its capacity for (a) tension. (b) torsion. (c) compression. (d) contraction.
output: Steel is used for cables in suspension bridges because of its capacity for tension. So the answer is (a).

input: In which layer of the atmosphere does most of Earth's weather occur? (a) the exosphere, which is the outermost layer. (b) the troposphere, which is the lowest layer. (c) the thermosphere, which has the highest temperature. (d) the stratosphere, which contains a sub-layer of ozone.
output: The troposphere is the layer of the atmosphere where most of Earth's weather occurs. So the answer is (b).

input: When light is reflected off an object and enters the eye, it falls on the (a) lens. (b) pupil. (c) retina. (d) cornea.
output: The light falls on the retina, which is the innermost layer of the eye. So the answer is (c).

input: The skin, lungs, and kidneys work together to (a) help eliminate body wastes. (b) help blood circulate. (c) aid in digestion. (d) aid in respiration.
output: The skin, lungs, and kidneys work together to help eliminate body wastes. So the answer is (a).

input: Which type of matter can be separated by physical means? (a) atom. (b) element. (c) compound. (d) mixture.
output: A mixture can be separated by physical means. So the answer is (d).

input: Which plant part is described correctly? (a) Stems make seeds. (b) Roots absorb nutrients. (c) Leaves absorb water. (d) Flowers make food.
output: Leaves absorb water. So the answer is (c).

input: Which process causes sand grains to stick together to form sandstone? (a) abrasion. (b) cementation. (c) combustion. (d) erosion.
output: Sand grains stick together to form sandstone due to cementation. So the answer is (b).

input: Plants store energy in what form? (a) heat. (b) light. (c) chemical. (d) mechanical.
output: Plants store energy in chemical form. So the answer is (c).

input: A student placed a rock in a graduated cylinder containing water, causing the water level in the cylinder to increase by 20 mL. This increase represents the rock's (1) mass. (2) volume. (3) solubility. (4) temperature.
output: The increase in water level represents the rock's volume. So the answer is (b).

input: Researchers are investigating whether dinosaurs were endothermic like birds. Which evidence from the fossil record could be effectively compared with modern day evidence to support this hypothesis? (a) similarities in bone structure. (b) seasonal shifts in food supply. (c) consumption of the same plant species. (d) tree rings indicating the return of a similar climate.
output: Option (d) is the best choice because it is the only one that can be compared with modern day evidence. So the answer is (d).

input: A student pushes a box to slide it across the floor. Which statement explains why the box begins to move? (a) The weight of the box is greater than the force of friction. (b) The weight of the box is less than the force of friction. (c) The applied force is greater than the force of friction. (d) The applied force is less than the force of friction.
output: The applied force is greater than the force of friction. So the answer is (c).

input: Which article might appear in a scientific magazine? (a) "The Religions of South America". (b) "The Money Systems of South America". (c) "The Flora and Fauna of South America". (d) "The Political Systems of South America".
output: The article "The Flora and Fauna of South America" is most likely to appear in a scientific magazine. So the answer is (c).

input: A train travels at a rate of 13 meters per second (m/s). Over the next 60 seconds, the speed of the train increases to speed to 22 m/s. What is the average rate of acceleration of the train? (a) 0.15 m/s^2. (b) 0.21 m/s^2. (c) 0.36 m/s^2. (d) 0.58 m/s^2.
output: The average rate of acceleration is the change in speed divided by the time. So the answer is (b).

input: Which trait is common in gases that contribute to Earth's greenhouse effect? (a) the ability to trap heat. (b) a tendency to lose electrons. (c) a tendency to exist as diatomic molecules. (d) the ability to bond with multiple other elements.
output: Option (a), the ability to trap heat, is the common trait in gases that contribute to Earth's greenhouse effect. So the answer is (a).

input: George is studying erosion. He learns how rocks break apart over time. Which of these most likely forms when a rock weathers and breaks into small pieces? (a) fossils. (b) crystals. (c) minerals. (d) sediments.
output: When a rock weathers and breaks into small pieces, sediments are formed. So the answer is (d).

input: As wave frequency is increased, wave energy (a) stays constant. (b) is unaffected. (c) increases. (d) decreases.
output: As wave frequency is increased, wave energy decreases. So the answer is (c).

input: A student is pouring equal amounts of water, maple syrup, and cooking oil into a glass beaker and looking at how the layers settle. Which property of the liquids is the student most likely comparing? (a) density. (b) mass. (c) temperature. (d) volume.
output: The student is comparing the density of the liquids. So the answer is (a).

input: Betsy tries to attract a variety of birds to her backyard. She puts up a bird feeder that contains sunflower seeds and corn. Which term best describes the contents of the bird feeder? (a) a mixture. (b) a solution. (c) an element. (d) a compound.
output: The bird feeder contains a mixture of two different types of seeds. So the answer is (a).

input: Which best describes construction technology? (a) exchanging information electronically. (b) changing raw materials into goods. (c) building and finishing a structure. (d) converting and transmitting energy.
output: Construction technology is the process of building and finishing a structure. So the answer is (c).

input: What eventually happens to a species when the environment changes and the organisms do not adapt? (1) classification. (2) development. (3) extinction. (4) regulation.
output: When a species cannot adapt to the changes in the environment, it will eventually become extinct. So the answer is (c).

input: Similar types of cells form tissues. What is the next level of complexity formed from the grouping of tissues? (a) organs. (b) organelles. (c) organisms. (d) organ systems.
output: Organs are formed from the grouping of tissues. So the answer is (a).

input: Which form of energy is produced when a rubber band vibrates? (1) chemical. (2) light. (3) electrical. (4) sound.
output: Sound is produced when a rubber band vibrates. So the answer is (d).

input: Which discovery was necessary before radio could be invented? (a) reflection. (b) radiation. (c) electricity. (d) gravity.
output: Reflection is the key to radio. So the answer is (a).

input: Which statement would most likely be included in a news report about an approaching hurricane? (1) Open the windows to equalize air pressure. (2) Install snow tires and check the antifreeze in the car radiator. (3) Evacuate low-lying areas near the coast. (4) Expect wind speed to decrease for the next several hours.
output: Option (4) is the most likely statement to be included in a news report about an approaching hurricane. So the answer is (d).

input: The energy produced by a burner on a gas stove is primarily (a) electrical. (b) heat. (c) mechanical. (d) sound.
output: The energy produced by a burner on a gas stove is primarily heat. So the answer is (b).

input: Students compare two different rocks. The rocks are both bright and spotted. Which property are the students most likely observing? (a) layers. (b) textures. (c) colors. (d) ages.
output: The property of rocks that are bright and spotted is the color. So the answer is (c).

input: Which of the following makes up the smallest region in the electromagnetic spectrum? (a) radio waves. (b) infrared light. (c) visible light. (d) gamma rays.
output: The smallest region in the electromagnetic spectrum is gamma rays. So the answer is (d).

input: In a northern state, a room used for growing plants is not allowing enough light to enter for healthy plant growth. Adding windows in walls facing which direction would best solve this problem? (a) north. (b) south. (c) east. (d) west.
output: The sun rises in the east and sets in the west, so the answer is (b).

input: A student finds a bottle that is labeled with a long chemical name. What is the best way for the student to learn more about the chemical properties of this substance? (a) shake the container vigorously. (b) smell a very small amount of it. (c) look up the name in a science book. (d) test a small amount to see if it feels slippery.
output: The best way for the student to learn more about the chemical properties of this substance is to look up the name in a science book. So the answer is (c).

input: The length of a year on Earth is a little over 365 days. The length of a year on a planet is best described as the time it takes for which to occur? (a) the planet to revolve once around the Sun. (b) the seasons to complete a full cycle. (c) the planet to rotate once on its axis. (d) the Sun to rotate once on its axis.
output: The length of a year is the time it takes for the planet to revolve around the Sun. So the answer is (a).

input: The human body has different levels of organization. In the structural organization of the central nervous system, which is an organ? (a) brain. (b) grey matter. (c) nerve. (d) neuron.
output: The central nervous system is composed of the brain and the spinal cord. So the answer is (a).

input: Increased human populations can lead to the depletion of locally available resources within communities. Compared to other communities, which of these locally available resources is most likely to be depleted in desert communities? (a) mineral. (b) oxygen. (c) gasoline. (d) water.
output: Option (d), water, is the most likely resource to be depleted in desert communities. So the answer is (d).

input: A hot pack is a product that releases heat when chemicals inside of it interact. What is taking place inside an active hot pack? (a) electric current. (b) a net loss of mass. (c) thermal insulation. (d) an exothermic reaction.
output: An exothermic reaction is taking place inside an active hot pack. So the answer is (d).

input: Respiration is a process during which energy is released from glucose. This energy is used for processes such as growth of the body. Which type of energy does respiration release? (a) chemical. (b) kinetic. (c) potential. (d) thermal.
output: Respiration releases energy in the form of heat. So the answer is (d).

input: An organism that breaks down dead plants and animals, returning matter back into the soil, is called a (a) herbivore. (b) producer. (c) competitor. (d) decomposer.
output: Decomposers break down dead plants and animals, returning matter back into the soil. So the answer is (d).

input: What type of cell passes on mutations? (a) skin cell. (b) nerve cell. (c) red blood cell. (d) egg cell.
output: A mutation is a change in the DNA sequence of a gene. So the answer is (d).

input: Which population would be harmed first by a long period of drought? (a) seaweed in an ocean. (b) fish in a lake. (c) plants in a pond. (d) fish in a bay.
output: Option (a), seaweed in an ocean, is the most likely to be harmed first by a long period of drought. So the answer is (a).

input: The house cat was believed to be tamed in ancient Egypt. In 2004, the remains of an eight-month old cat buried with its owner were discovered on the Mediterranean island of Cyprus. The date of burial, however, came before Egyptian civilization. Which best explains the importance of the discovery? (a) Wildcats are not related to house cats. (b) Cats were domesticated earlier than originally thought. (c) Wildcats were not domesticated. (d) The period of Egyptian civilization was older than originally thought.
output: The discovery of the cat skeleton in Cyprus shows that cats were domesticated earlier than originally thought. So the answer is (b).

input: Which activity requires the use of safety goggles to protect the eyes? (a) collecting rain water. (b) measuring air temperature. (c) classifying flowers. (d) pouring vinegar.
output: Pouring vinegar requires the use of safety goggles to protect the eyes. So the answer is (d).

input: The most common source of nonrenewable resources used to generate electricity in the state of Nevada is (a) oil. (b) coal. (c) geothermal. (d) hydroelectric.
output: The most common source of nonrenewable resources used to generate electricity in the state of Nevada is coal. So the answer is (b).

input: A "light year" refers to (a) the distance light travels in one year. (b) the of time it takes light to travel from Earth to the Sun. (c) the amount of light required on Earth in one year. (d) the distance between two sources of light.
output: A light year is the distance light travels in one year. So the answer is (a).

input: All animals need air to survive. An insect gets air through tiny holes on the sides of its body. A whale breathes through a blow hole. What body part do fish use to breathe? (a) gills. (b) skin. (c) nose. (d) mouth.
output: Fish breathe through gills. So the answer is (a).

input: Which of the following tools would be most useful in determining the length and width of a school cafeteria? (a) scale. (b) centimeter ruler. (c) tape measure. (d) thermometer.
output: A scale is used to measure the weight of an object, so the answer is (a).

input: The extensive branching of neurons helps them to perform which function? (a) maintain structural stability. (b) stockpile chemical energy. (c) communicate with other neurons. (d) secrete hormones.
output: The extensive branching of neurons helps them to communicate with other neurons. So the answer is (c).

input: Which of the following are narrow belts of strong winds found in the upper troposphere? (a) doldrums. (b) westerlies. (c) trade winds. (d) jet streams.
output: Jet streams are narrow belts of strong winds found in the upper troposphere. So the answer is (d).

input: A hiker wants to know if air is warmer in a forest than in the nearby farm field. Which activity would best help the hiker find out which area is warmer? (a) reading a book about farm fields. (b) making a weather prediction for the forests. (c) measuring the wind speed at both locations. (d) recording the temperatures at both locations.
output: The hiker should record the temperatures at both locations. So the answer is (d).

input: Recently the telephone company announced the implementation of a new telephone area code for Massachusetts. What technological changes are responsible for the need for a new area code? (a) the increased size of the telephone book. (b) the increase in use of modems, fax machines, and cellular phones. (c) the increase in use of speed dialing and call waiting. (d) the increased demand for telephone repairs and installation.
output: The increase in use of modems, fax machines, and cellular phones is responsible for the need for a new area code. So the answer is (b).

input: Which of the following is a benefit of using radiation as a medical treatment? (a) It kills cancer cells. (b) It produces healthy cells. (c) It improves immune system function. (d) It prevents many forms of illness in patients.
output: Radiation is used to kill cancer cells, so the answer is (a).

input: Which of these statements best describes temperature as elevation in the atmosphere increases? (a) Temperature remains constant with elevation in the thermosphere. (b) Temperature remains constant with elevation in the mesosphere. (c) Temperature generally decreases with elevation in the stratosphere. (d) Temperature generally decreases with elevation in the troposphere.
output: Temperature generally decreases with elevation in the troposphere. So the answer is (d).

input: The transfer of heat in the atmosphere by winds that circulate between the equator and the poles is an example of (a) radiation. (b) insulation. (c) convection. (d) conduction.
output: Convection is the transfer of heat by the movement of a fluid. So the answer is (c).

input: Which is most responsible for the uneven heating of the air in the atmosphere? (a) radiation. (b) convection. (c) conduction. (d) condensation.
output: Conduction is the most responsible for the uneven heating of the air in the atmosphere. So the answer is (c).

input: Three gases found in Earth's atmosphere are carbon dioxide, nitrogen, and oxygen. What is their order of abundance from greatest to least? (a) nitrogen, oxygen, carbon dioxide. (b) nitrogen, carbon dioxide, oxygen. (c) oxygen, nitrogen, carbon dioxide. (d) carbon dioxide, oxygen, nitrogen.
output: The order of abundance of the three gases is nitrogen, oxygen, carbon dioxide. So the answer is (a).

input: Copper, silver, and nickel are all classified as (a) noble gases. (b) transition metals. (c) halogens. (d) nonmetals.
output: Noble gases are inert gases that do not react with other elements. So the answer is (b).

input: The body is made up of many systems that interact with one another. For example, the skeletal system and the muscular system work together to help the body move. Which system works with the respiratory system to distribute oxygen to the body? (a) muscular system. (b) digestive system. (c) lymphatic system. (d) circulatory system.
output: The circulatory system works with the respiratory system to distribute oxygen to the body. So the answer is (d).

input: Sediment that is deposited on a beach may come from a local source or be transported by which action? (a) swash. (b) rip currents. (c) river currents. (d) longshore drift.
output: Sediment that is deposited on a beach may come from a local source or be transported by longshore drift. So the answer is (d).

input: Sonar can be used to measure distances underwater. This is accomplished by sending a sound wave to a "target" while measuring the total time it takes for the wave to reach the target and then return to its source. Which of the following sound wave characteristics must be known when using sonar to measure distances? (a) amplitude. (b) wavelength. (c) frequency. (d) speed.
output: The speed of sound is the only characteristic that is known when using sonar to measure distances. So the answer is (d).

input: What major events cause islands to form in the Pacific Ocean? (a) tsunamis. (b) severe storms. (c) volcanic eruptions. (d) erosion.
output: Islands are formed by volcanic eruptions, so the answer is (c).

input: Fossil fuels are common sources of energy. What type of pollution is most often associated with burning fossil fuels? (a) air. (b) land. (c) noise. (d) water.
output: Fossil fuels are common sources of energy. Burning fossil fuels produces air pollution. So the answer is (a).

input: A boy and his sister both play piano. Playing piano is an example of (a) a physical change. (b) an inherited trait. (c) a life function. (d) a learned behavior.
output: Playing piano is a learned behavior. So the answer is (d).

input: Which is the best way to generate an electrical current in a coil of wire? (a) stroking the coil with a piece of silk. (b) heating the coil uniformly. (c) laying the coil near a magnet. (d) rotating the coil in a magnetic field.
output: The best way to generate an electrical current in a coil of wire is to rotate the coil in a magnetic field. So the answer is (d).

input: What property of water best helps aquatic life survive in lakes during the winter? (a) water has a high specific heat capacity. (b) water has a high surface tension. (c) water is less dense as a solid than as a liquid. (d) water is a polar molecule.
output: Water is less dense as a solid than as a liquid, so aquatic life can survive in lakes during the winter. So the answer is (c).

input: Which part of a plant helps the plant make food from sunlight? (a) leaf. (b) seed. (c) fruit. (d) pollen.
output: The leaf is the part of a plant that helps the plant make food from sunlight. So the answer is (a).

input: Which of the following is the main reason water at the surface of the ocean is warmer than water at the bottom of the ocean? (a) Water at the bottom of the ocean contains more dissolved solids. (b) Water at the surface of the ocean absorbs more energy from the Sun. (c) Friction is created by fast moving currents at the surface of the ocean. (d) Wave action transfers heat from the bottom of the ocean to the surface.
output: The answer is (b). Water at the surface of the ocean absorbs more energy from the Sun. So the answer is (b).

input: A student finds an animal in the wild. He decides it is a bird because it has (a) fins. (b) scales. (c) feathers. (d) four legs.
output: The student is wrong because birds have feathers, not fins. So the answer is (c).

input: Many scientists accept the theory that excess emission of carbon dioxide from cars and industry causes a layer of gas in the upper atmosphere that traps heat. This, in turn, causes the average temperature on Earth to rise. Which of the following observations supports that theory? (a) The summer of 1998 was one of the hottest summer seasons on record. (b) Carbon dioxide gas from cars and industry is a product of burning that produces heat. (c) Carbon dioxide in the upper atmosphere reflects heat radiated from Earth's surface. (d) Radiation on Earth's surface is increasing because of a hole in the ozone layer.
output: The theory is that the excess emission of carbon dioxide from cars and industry causes a layer of gas in the upper atmosphere that traps heat. This, in turn, causes the average temperature on Earth to rise. So the answer is (c).

input: Why is it important to protect soil? (a) It covers the bedrock layer in the earth. (b) It has nutrients used by plants to grow. (c) It holds many harmful pollutants. (d) It dries quickly in sunlight.
output: Soil is important because it has nutrients used by plants to grow. So the answer is (b).

input: Fungi recycle leaves in forests. Fungi release chemicals onto the leaves to break them down into smaller particles. The fungi use the small particles for growth. Which process allows fungi to obtain the nutrients they need from dead leaves? (a) circulation. (b) digestion. (c) reproduction. (d) respiration.
output: The process that allows fungi to obtain the nutrients they need from dead leaves is digestion. So the answer is (b).

input: Sandstone and all other types of sedimentary rock are made up of particles. The source materials of these particles consist of (a) fragments that broke off of older rocks. (b) magma that cooled deep below a volcano. (c) gases that condensed in the atmosphere. (d) vegetation that decayed in thick layers.
output: Sandstone and other sedimentary rocks are made up of particles that are fragments that broke off of older rocks. So the answer is (a).

input: A tree uses gas A to produce gas B. An animal uses gas B to produce gas A. What is gas B in this cycle? (a) oxygen. (b) nitrogen. (c) carbon dioxide. (d) carbon monoxide.
output: The animal uses gas B to produce gas A, so gas B is carbon dioxide. So the answer is (c).

input: Which of the following is produced when two or more elements combine in a chemical reaction? (a) atom. (b) compound. (c) mixture. (d) solution.
output: A compound is produced when two or more elements combine in a chemical reaction. So the answer is (b).

input: A research team has made new discoveries about magnetism. Which of these statements best describes the value to society of publishing their discoveries? (a) Their results will be unchangeable. (b) The research team may become famous. (c) The publishing company may make money. (d) Their discoveries can be built on by other researchers.
output: The value of publishing their discoveries is that other researchers can build on their discoveries. So the answer is (d).

input: Which object in the sky is a satellite of the planet Earth? (a) Sun. (b) Moon. (c) Mars. (d) Saturn.
output: The Moon is a satellite of the planet Earth. So the answer is (b).

input: Which statement describes a property of water that most likely causes large rocks to break apart? (a) Water expands when it freezes. (b) Water forms droplets as it falls. (c) Water turns into a gas when it boils. (d) Water takes the shape of its container.
output: Water expands when it freezes, so it can break large rocks apart. So the answer is (a).

input: Which of these provides the best evidence that an environmental change has occurred? (a) a freshwater lake in the mountains. (b) marine fossils in a freshwater lake. (c) saltwater clams in the ocean. (d) a sandy beach next to the ocean.
output: Option (b) is the best evidence that an environmental change has occurred. So the answer is (b).

input: An ice cube is put into a heated pan. What will most likely happen to the molecules in the ice as the ice is heated? (a) The molecules will begin to move slower. (b) The molecules will begin to move faster. (c) The molecules will begin to increase in density. (d) The molecules will begin to condense in the air.
output: The molecules will begin to move faster. So the answer is (b).

input: Dr. Mendez specializes in patients who have osteoarthritis. His patients often complain of pain and swelling due to loss of cartilage. Which system is most affected by this disease? (a) cardiovascular. (b) digestive. (c) immune. (d) musculoskeletal.
output: The musculoskeletal system is most affected by this disease. So the answer is (d).

input: During the construction of a new building, workers dug round holes in the ground and filled the holes with steel and concrete. Which of the following parts of the building was being built during this stage of construction? (a) the floor. (b) the foundation. (c) the plumbing. (d) the walls.
output: The foundation is the part of the building that is built during this stage of construction. So the answer is (b).

input: Centuries ago, people used their knowledge of the stars to (a) navigate ships. (b) study the weather. (c) predict volcanic eruptions. (d) map the Earth's surface.
output: Centuries ago, people used their knowledge of the stars to navigate ships. So the answer is (a).

input: Which of these is the BEST way to save animals and trees? (a) Ride bikes more. (b) Make more farmland. (c) Take care of forests. (d) Move to the city.
output: Option (c), taking care of forests is the best way to save animals and trees. So the answer is (c).

input: From what source does almost all heat energy on Earth come? (a) Wind. (b) Water. (c) The Sun. (d) The Moon.
output: The Sun is the source of almost all heat energy on Earth. So the answer is (c).

input: Overgrazing of land by livestock contributes to a major problem. That problem is (a) depletion of ground water. (b) increased pollution. (c) erosion of soil. (d) acid rain.
output: Overgrazing of land by livestock contributes to erosion of soil. So the answer is (c).

input: Which tool would be most useful in studying the living organisms the students collected from the pond? (a) balance. (b) pH meter. (c) microscope. (d) thermometer.
output: A microscope is the most useful tool in studying living organisms. So the answer is (c).

input: Which is the Sun most likely to become toward the end of its lifetime? (a) a protostar. (b) a black hole. (c) a neutron star. (d) a white dwarf star.
output: The Sun is a star, so it is most likely to become a white dwarf star. So the answer is (d).

input: Acid rain is the result of pollutants being released into the (a) air. (b) soil. (c) rivers. (d) oceans.
output: Acid rain is the result of pollutants being released into the air. So the answer is (a).

input: The job of the bladder in an animal is to store wastes. Which organ in an animal removes wastes from the blood? (a) liver. (b) heart. (c) stomach. (d) kidney.
output: The kidney is the organ that removes wastes from the blood. So the answer is (d).

input: Animals get the energy they need for growth and repair by (a) eating food. (b) absorbing sunlight. (c) eliminating waste. (d) drinking water.
output: Animals get the energy they need for growth and repair by eating food. So the answer is (a).

input: Which of these cell types has DNA that is not bound in a nuclear membrane? (a) a plant cell. (b) a protist cell. (c) an animal cell. (d) a prokaryote cell.
output: Option (d), prokaryote cell, has DNA that is not bound in a nuclear membrane. So the answer is (d).

input: In humans, digestion begins in the mouth. The complete process of digestion occurs with the help of many different parts of the body. Which term best identifies the parts of the body that carry out the function of digestion? (a) an organ. (b) an organism. (c) a system. (d) a tissue.
output: The digestive system is made up of many different parts of the body. So the answer is (c).

input: Anita heats a beaker containing water. As the temperature of the water increases, which change to the water molecules occurs? (a) The molecules move at a faster rate. (b) The molecules become more massive. (c) The molecules expand and become wider. (d) The molecules separate into atoms of hydrogen and oxygen.
output: The temperature of the water increases, so the molecules move at a faster rate. So the answer is (a).

input: Which of the following are likely to do the most damage to ecosystems along the Rio Grande River? (a) floods. (b) tsunamis. (c) blizzards. (d) earthquakes.
output: Floods are the most likely to do the most damage to ecosystems along the Rio Grande River. So the answer is (a).

input: Which process is responsible for the growth and repair of human tissue? (1) evolution. (2) germination. (3) cell division. (4) natural selection.
output: The process of cell division is responsible for the growth and repair of human tissue. So the answer is (4).

input: Which sequence represents the correct levels of organization for multicellular organisms? (1) cell -> tissue -> organ -> organ system. (2) tissue -> organ -> cell -> organ system. (3) organ system -> organ -> cell -> tissue. (4) cell -> organ -> tissue -> organ system.
output: The correct sequence is (1) cell -> tissue -> organ -> organ system. So the answer is (a).

input: Convection currents in the mantle are thought to be the driving force behind tectonic movement. At which location do the convection currents cause the plates to diverge? (a) strike-slip fault. (b) subduction zone. (c) mid-ocean ridges. (d) folded mountains.
output: Convection currents in the mantle cause the plates to diverge at mid-ocean ridges. So the answer is (c).

input: A class made a solar cooker out of a large can. What color should they paint the can in order to collect the most heat? (a) black. (b) green. (c) pink. (d) white.
output: The color of the can should be black, because black absorbs the most heat. So the answer is (a).

input: Ann makes hats for people. She has each person select the fabric and a hat style before she makes the hat to fit the person's head size. Which type of manufacturing system is Ann most likely using to make hats? (a) mass production. (b) custom production. (c) automated production. (d) assembly line production.
output: Ann is using custom production to make hats. So the answer is (b).

input: What information would be most helpful to a person with allergies when selecting food products? (a) the ingredients. (b) the serving size. (c) the nutritional information. (d) the company that makes it.
output: The ingredients are the most important information for a person with allergies. So the answer is (a).

input: Which event takes about one year to complete? (a) Earth making a complete rotation. (b) the Moon making a complete rotation. (c) Earth revolving completely around the Sun. (d) the Moon revolving completely around Earth.
output: The Earth takes about one year to revolve completely around the Sun. So the answer is (c).

input: Which planet is fourth from the Sun in our solar system? (a) Mars. (b) Earth. (c) Venus. (d) Jupiter.
output: The order of the planets from the Sun is Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, and Pluto. So the answer is (c).

input: What force causes objects to be pulled toward Earth? (a) friction. (b) gravity. (c) light. (d) electricity.
output: Gravity is the force that pulls objects toward Earth. So the answer is (b).

input: What do the long vine of an ivy plant and the trunk of an oak tree have in common? (a) They are both flexible. (b) They are both stiff. (c) They both make food for a plant. (d) They both give support to a plant.
output: Both the long vine of an ivy plant and the trunk of an oak tree are both stiff. So the answer is (b).

input: Students wanted to see if the growth of a plant was affected by using four different types of soil. How should the students best carry out this investigation after potting the plants in the four different types of soil? (a) observe the plants and record observations daily. (b) move the plants to new locations every day. (c) measure the height of each plant every hour. (d) add different amounts of water to each plant.
output: The best way to carry out this investigation is to observe the plants and record observations daily. So the answer is (a).

input: In the 16005 Robert Hooke invented an improved type of microscope. Which of these was a direct result of this invention? (a) The first view of atoms and molecules. (b) Detailed observations of Jupiter and Mars. (c) The name spectrum for the colors of light. (d) The term cell to describe the smallest unit of life.
output: The invention of the microscope allowed for the first view of atoms and molecules. So the answer is (a).

input: The number of neutrons in an atom is found by subtracting (a) atomic number from mass number. (b) mass number from atomic number. (c) atomic number from electron number. (d) isotope number from electron number.
output: The number of neutrons in an atom is found by subtracting the atomic number from the mass number. So the answer is (a).

input: As the distance between a magnet and a metal paper clip increases, the force of attraction between them (a) decreases. (b) increases. (c) remains the same.
output: The force of attraction between a magnet and a metal paper clip decreases as the distance between them increases. So the answer is (a).

input: Nutrients enter the bloodstream during the process of (1) locomotion. (2) respiration. (3) elimination. (4) absorption.
output: Nutrients enter the bloodstream during the process of absorption. So the answer is (4).

input: Which set of elements have chemical properties similar to those of phosphorus? (a) nitrogen, arsenic, and antimony. (b) carbon, selenium, and iodine. (c) silicon, sulfur, and germanium. (d) silicon, sulfur, and chlorine.
output: Phosphorus is a nonmetal, and the other elements are nonmetals as well. So the answer is (c).

input: Tides occur in the oceans at regular times every day because of (a) upper atmospheric disturbances. (b) the tilt of Earth's rotational axis. (c) density differences caused by temperature changes. (d) the gravitational pull of the Sun and the Moon.
output: The gravitational pull of the Sun and the Moon is the most likely cause for tides. So the answer is (d).

input: What is the name of the process in the water cycle shown by label 1? (a) infiltration. (b) evaporation. (c) condensation. (d) precipitation.
output: The process in the water cycle shown by label 1 is precipitation. So the answer is (d).

input: What force pulls things towards the center of Earth? (a) magnetism. (b) gravity. (c) friction. (d) energy.
output: Gravity is the force that pulls things towards the center of Earth. So the answer is (b).

input: Earth can be viewed as an engine and heat exchange is part of the engine system. Which would be an example of a transfer of energy from the atmosphere to the lithosphere? (a) A volcano erupts in the state of Washington. (b) An earthquake takes place off the coast of Japan. (c) A wild fire scorches a prairie in the upper Midwest. (d) A hurricane moves from the Gulf of Mexico onto land.
output: Option (b) is the only option that involves the transfer of energy from the atmosphere to the lithosphere. So the answer is (b).

input: All energy resources have benefits, risks, and drawbacks. Which two resources present the most dangerous risks and consequences for the environment during their acquisition? (a) oil and coal. (b) coal and solar energy. (c) geothermal energy and oil. (d) solar energy and geothermal energy.
output: Option (a) is the correct answer. Oil and coal are the most dangerous resources for the environment during their acquisition. So the answer is (a).

input: A puppy has traits from its mother and its father. Which of these structures provides genetic information from the father to the puppy? (a) a muscle cell. (b) a nerve cell. (c) a blood cell. (d) a sperm cell.
output: A sperm cell is the only cell that can provide genetic information from the father to the puppy. So the answer is (d).

input: A scientist performs an experiment which suggests a new explanation for the digestion of certain proteins in humans. These results should first be communicated to the scientific community by which means? (a) submission of an article to a peer-reviewed journal. (b) inclusion of the new explanation in a biology textbook. (c) posting observations and conclusions on the scientist's website. (d) inviting reporters from many organizations to a press conference.
output: The best way to communicate the new explanation is to submit an article to a peer-reviewed journal. So the answer is (a).

input: Juan noticed that sunny skies suddenly became stormy. Which most likely happened when the weather changed in this way? (a) Winds weakened. (b) Humidity decreased. (c) Air pressure dropped. (d) Temperatures increased.
output: When the weather changes from sunny to stormy, the air pressure drops. So the answer is (c).

input: Which process causes water to move from the ocean to the atmosphere during the formation of a hurricane? (a) condensation. (b) evaporation. (c) precipitation. (d) runoff.
output: Condensation is the process that causes water to move from the ocean to the atmosphere during the formation of a hurricane. So the answer is (a).

input: A student places a chemical in an insulated container and measures the temperature. A second chemical is added and the container is sealed and the temperature is monitored. What is the student trying to determine? (a) What color changes can be observed?. (b) How much precipitate is formed?. (c) Is heat absorbed or released?. (d) How can this reaction be reversed?.
output: The student is trying to determine if heat is absorbed or released. So the answer is (c).

input: Which is an example of asexual reproduction? (a) one cell divides into two cells. (b) two cells unite to form one cell. (c) a gene in a cell mutates. (d) egg cells are produced.
output: Option (a) is an example of asexual reproduction. So the answer is (a).

input: The sum of all chemical reactions that take place within an organism is known as (1) evolution. (2) metabolism. (3) circulation. (4) reproduction.
output: Metabolism is the sum of all chemical reactions that take place within an organism. So the answer is (b).

input: The appearance of the Moon as observed from Earth changes over time because of the Moon's (a) path around Earth. (b) length of daylight. (c) gravity. (d) temperature.
output: The appearance of the Moon as observed from Earth changes over time because of the Moon's path around Earth. So the answer is (a).

input: The basic life functions of an organism are carried on by (1) cells. (2) nutrients. (3) atoms. (4) hormones.
output: The basic life functions of an organism are carried on by cells. So the answer is (1).

input: What keeps stars such as the Sun from collapsing from their own self-gravity? (a) the centrifugal force created by rapid rotation. (b) the electrical repulsion of nuclei in the plasma. (c) the gravitational pull created by orbiting planets. (d) the outward pressure created by nuclear fusion.
output: The outward pressure created by nuclear fusion is the answer. So the answer is (d).

input: The increasing use of internal combustion engines could eventually deplete which resource? (a) wind energy. (b) petroleum. (c) uranium. (d) solar energy.
output: The increasing use of internal combustion engines will eventually deplete petroleum. So the answer is (b).

input: If the results of an experiment do not support the hypothesis, the scientist will most likely do all of the following except (a) check for errors in the experimental procedure. (b) repeat the experiment. (c) change data to support the hypothesis. (d) ask new questions.
output: If the results of an experiment do not support the hypothesis, the scientist will most likely repeat the experiment. So the answer is (b).

input: Which has the longest wavelength? (a) red light. (b) green light. (c) violet light. (d) yellow light.
output: The longest wavelength is violet light. So the answer is (c).

input: Which statement best describes how birth and death rates compare in a population at carrying capacity? (a) The birth rate is greater than the death rate. (b) The birth rate is less than the death rate. (c) The birth rate is equal to the death rate. (d) The birth rate and the death rate are zero.
output: The birth rate is equal to the death rate at carrying capacity. So the answer is (c).

input: Your community is planning to build a new sanitary landfill. In locating the landfill, which is the most important environmental consideration? (a) the cost of the land. (b) the location of the groundwater. (c) the proximity to an industrial park. (d) the accessibility to a major highway.
output: The most important environmental consideration is the location of the groundwater. So the answer is (b).

input: Which is the best conductor of electricity? (a) air. (b) glass. (c) water. (d) wood.
output: The best conductor of electricity is water. So the answer is (c).

input: Students compared the growth rate of the roots of basil plants in three different water solutions. Measurements were recorded every other day for eight weeks. Which unit of measure is most appropriate for this investigation? (a) meters. (b) centiliters. (c) millimeters. (d) liters.
output: The unit of measure is most appropriate for this investigation is (c) millimeters.

input: When placed in a container at room temperature, which substance has a definite volume but takes the shape of the container? (a) ice. (b) copper. (c) water. (d) wood.
output: Wood is a porous substance, so it will take the shape of the container. So the answer is (d).

input: Elements on the right side of the periodic table differ from the elements on the left side in that the elements on the right side (a) are solid at room temperature. (b) are good electrical conductors. (c) generally have very high densities. (d) tend to form ions by gaining electrons.
output: Option (d) is the correct answer. The elements on the right side of the periodic table tend to form ions by gaining electrons. So the answer is (d).

input: Astronomers have found low-energy background radiation in every part of the sky that they have studied. This radiation is taken as evidence of energy remaining from which event? (a) supernovas. (b) the big bang. (c) collisions of galaxies. (d) modern decay of unstable atoms.
output: The background radiation is taken as evidence of energy remaining from the big bang. So the answer is (b).

input: A class is studying how gravity affects objects in motion. Which tool would best measure the distance an object travels after it is thrown? (a) a magnetic compass. (b) a meter stick. (c) a calculator. (d) a stop watch.
output: A stop watch is the best tool to measure the distance an object travels after it is thrown. So the answer is (d).

input: If the Earth did not tilt on its axis in relation to the sun, which of the following would also be true? (a) There would be no seasons. (b) One Earth-year would be 14% longer. (c) The Earth would spin at a different rate. (d) Temperatures at the Earth's equator would cool.
output: If the Earth did not tilt on its axis in relation to the sun, the Earth would spin at a different rate. So the answer is (c).

input: In the 20th century, Edwin Hubble deduced from observations that there are galaxies other than the Milky Way. Hubble's observations depended on improvements in a technology first developed by which scientist? (a) Democritus. (b) Isaac Newton. (c) Galileo Galilei. (d) Anton Van Leeuwenhoek.
output: The answer is (c).

input: What is one of the major advantages of using hydroelectric power? (a) It uses renewable natural resources. (b) It is easily generated in most big cities. (c) It can be generated from any area on Earth. (d) It does not require special buildings or equipment.
output: Hydroelectric power is generated from water, which is a renewable natural resource. So the answer is (a).

input: What is the difference between magma and lava? (a) Magma is below ground. Lava is above ground. (b) Magma is cool. Lava is hot. (c) Magma comes out of earthquakes. Lava comes out of volcanoes. (d) Magma is solid. Lava is liquid.
output: Magma is a liquid rock below ground, while lava is a liquid rock above ground. So the answer is (c).

input: Scientists today understand how forces work due to Isaac Newton's study of (a) electricity. (b) magnetism. (c) atoms. (d) gravity.
output: Newton's study of gravity is the most important factor in understanding how forces work. So the answer is (d).

input: On a day in early spring, the number of hours of daylight and of night are about the same. From sunrise to sunset on a spring day, Earth has (a) completed half of one rotation. (b) been in the shadow of the Moon. (c) been circled by the Moon one time. (d) moved to the opposite side of the Sun.
output: The Earth has completed half of one rotation on a spring day. So the answer is (a).

input: A marsh in your neighborhood dried up during a long, hot summer. This is most likely to cause which of the following changes in the neighborhood? (a) an increase in the number of bats. (b) a decrease in the number of mosquitoes. (c) an increase in the number of insect-eating birds. (d) a decrease in the number of Japanese beetles.
output: Option (b), decrease in the number of mosquitoes, is the most likely cause for a marsh to dry up. So the answer is (b).

input: In an effort to preserve wildlife on his farm in Massachusetts, a farmer decides to stop using a 10-acre field. The farmer fences off the area, stops cutting the grass, and stops allowing livestock to graze on it. After twenty years, the area would most likely (a) be covered with moss and rocks. (b) be a mature hardwood forest. (c) be grown over with bushes and small trees. (d) be barren due to lack of maintenance.
output: The farmer stops cutting the grass and stops allowing livestock to graze on it. So the answer is (c).

input: Penny's class was learning how rapidly some changes can happen on Earth. Which event causes the fastest change to the surface of Earth? (a) water flowing in a riverbed. (b) a wave crashing on a beach. (c) an earthquake cracking a road. (d) wind blowing against a mountain.
output: The fastest change to the surface of Earth is an earthquake cracking a road. So the answer is (d).

input: Air that travels away from the equator fails to maintain a straight path. The path of the air is deflected to the right in the Northern Hemisphere and to the left in the Southern Hemisphere. The apparent deflection of air to either the right or left is known as the Coriolis Effect. Which factor produces the Coriolis Effect? (a) the gravity of Earth. (b) the rotation of Earth. (c) the axial tilt of Earth. (d) the revolution of Earth.
output: The Coriolis Effect is caused by the rotation of Earth. So the answer is (b).

input: When coal is burned to produce electricity, the electrical energy produced is less than the potential energy in the coal. Which best explains this observation? (a) As coal is heated, some of the molecules move so fast that they are destroyed. (b) Some of the energy in coal is destroyed by the intense heat required to release its potential energy. (c) Some of the potential energy in coal is converted into forms of energy other than electricity. (d) The amount of potential energy in fuels is overestimated.
output: The amount of potential energy in fuels is overestimated. So the answer is (c).

input: When a person's arm touches something hot, the muscles in the arm react to pull the arm away. Which body system alerts the muscles to react? (a) Nervous. (b) Digestive. (c) Circulatory. (d) Respiratory.
output: The nervous system alerts the muscles to react. So the answer is (a).

input: Two chemicals are mixed in a test tube and a chemical reaction takes place. If this reaction is endothermic and the test tube is touched, which of the following best describes what is felt? (a) The test tube is cold. (b) The test tube is warm. (c) The test tube is very hot. (d) The test tube is the same temperature as the air.
output: The test tube is cold. So the answer is (a).

input: The width of a pencil lead is most accurately measured in (a) meters. (b) inches. (c) millimeters. (d) feet.
output: The width of a pencil lead is most accurately measured in millimeters. So the answer is (c).

input: Which organism is able to work together with other cells of its species? (a) amoeba. (b) euglena. (c) paramecium. (d) volvox.
output: Paramecium is a unicellular organism, so it cannot work together with other cells of its species. So the answer is (d).

input: Which of the following items is necessary in a laboratory for safety purposes? (a) Triple-beam balance. (b) Metric ruler. (c) Computer monitor. (d) Fire extinguisher.
output: A fire extinguisher is necessary for safety purposes. So the answer is (d).

input: Which type of energy is carried through a metal cable? (a) light. (b) chemical. (c) electrical. (d) nuclear.
output: Electrical energy is carried through a metal cable. So the answer is (c).

input: Glaciers cover about 10% of the total land area on Earth. The role of glaciers in the water cycle is to (a) filter salt water. (b) store fresh water. (c) move liquid water. (d) precipitate solid water.
output: Glaciers are formed by the accumulation of snow, which is a form of water. So the answer is (c).

input: The density of a material can be measured by using a (a) meter stick and test tubes. (b) beaker and stopwatch. (c) thermometer and computer probes. (d) balance and graduated cylinder.
output: The density of a material can be measured by using a balance and graduated cylinder. So the answer is (d).

input: Which of the following describes diffraction? (a) the bouncing back of waves as they meet a surface. (b) the bending of waves as they pass from one medium to another. (c) the bending of waves as they pass an edge or an opening. (d) the combining of two waves that meet at a point.
output: Option (c) describes diffraction. So the answer is (c).

input: What is one way in which workplace automation can have a negative effect on society? (a) reducing the number of job-related injuries. (b) producing manufactured objects at a faster rate. (c) displacing skilled workers from manufacturing jobs. (d) decreasing the availability of manufactured products.
output: Option (c), displacing skilled workers from manufacturing jobs, is one way in which workplace automation can have a negative effect on society. So the answer is (c).

input: Which layer of the atmosphere contains about 75% of the gasses and almost all of the water vapor? (a) troposphere. (b) stratosphere. (c) mesosphere. (d) thermosphere.
output: The troposphere is the layer of the atmosphere that contains about 75% of the gasses and almost all of the water vapor. So the answer is (a).

input: India was once its own continent. According to the theory of continental drift, India has collided with and become part of the continent of Asia. This caused (a) glaciers in the area to melt. (b) large mountain ranges to form. (c) deep mid-ocean trenches to develop. (d) deserts in the area to become fertile.
output: The collision of India with Asia caused the formation of deep mid-ocean trenches. So the answer is (c).

input: Why are many desert animals more active at night? (a) It is drier at night. (b) It is cooler at night. (c) There is less danger at night. (d) There is less wind at night.
output: Many desert animals are more active at night because it is cooler at night. So the answer is (b).

input: If the Earth rotated in the opposite direction, what would most likely occur? (a) The Sun would rise in the west. (b) The seasons would be reversed. (c) There would be more days in each year. (d) The phases of the Moon would last longer.
output: The Earth rotates in the same direction as the Moon orbits the Earth. If the Earth rotated in the opposite direction, the Moon would orbit the Earth in the opposite direction. So the answer is (b).

input: A student uses a fan and a box of sand to model the formation of sand dunes. This model shows the effect of which natural factor on the landscape? (a) wind. (b) water. (c) temperature. (d) gravity.
output: The formation of sand dunes is caused by wind. So the answer is (a).

input: Evan is performing an investigation. Before conducting his investigation, what must Evan do? (a) record his observations. (b) develop a hypothesis. (c) reach a conclusion. (d) organize the data.
output: Before conducting an investigation, Evan must first organize the data. So the answer is (d).

input: When a skydiver jumps from a plane, the open parachute will increase the air resistance by (a) reducing fluid friction. (b) increasing surface area. (c) increasing terminal velocity. (d) decreasing mass.
output: The parachute will increase the air resistance by increasing surface area. So the answer is (b).

input: If you took all of the atoms out of a chair, what would be left? (a) The chair would still be there, but it would weigh less. (b) The chair would be exactly the same as it was before. (c) There would be nothing left of the chair. (d) Only a pool of liquid would be left on the floor.
output: The chair is made up of atoms, so if you took all the atoms out of the chair, there would be nothing left of the chair. So the answer is (c).

input: Which of these is the center of our solar system? (a) Mars. (b) The moon. (c) Jupiter. (d) The sun.
output: The sun is the center of our solar system. So the answer is (d).

input: Which of these best describes the Moon? (a) Older than Earth. (b) Smaller than Earth. (c) Having the same climate as Earth. (d) Having the same atmosphere as Earth.
output: The Moon is smaller than Earth, so the answer is (b).

input: The color of a star indicates its (a) speed. (b) volume. (c) distance. (d) temperature.
output: The color of a star indicates its temperature. So the answer is (d).

input: Which type of organism helps return nutrients from dead plants and animals to the soil? (a) producer. (b) prey. (c) predator. (d) decomposer.
output: Decomposers are organisms that help return nutrients from dead plants and animals to the soil. So the answer is (d).

input: When mining for coal, a mining company removes the plants and layers of soil and rock above the coal deposit, and takes the coal. When the operation is complete, the mining company returns soil and rock, covers it with a layer of topsoil, and plants trees and grass. The trees and grass help to (a) prevent a collapse of the underlying sediment. (b) limit the types of pollutants that can enter the soil. (c) increase water absorption by the replaced sediments. (d) reduce soil erosion and provide new habitat for animals.
output: The trees and grass help to prevent a collapse of the underlying sediment. So the answer is (a).

input: A model of an atom includes red marbles for electrons, green marbles for protons, and blue marbles for neutrons. All marbles have a radius of 2 cm. How could the model be changed to represent more properties of an atom? (a) by using smaller marbles to represent electrons. (b) by using two marbles to represent each neutron. (c) by using two differently colored marbles for protons. (d) by switching the colors of the marbles.
output: The model can be changed by using smaller marbles to represent electrons. So the answer is (a).

input: The smallest particle of matter that can be identified as an element is called (a) an atom. (b) a proton. (c) an electron. (d) a molecule.
output: An atom is the smallest particle of matter that can be identified as an element. So the answer is (a).

input: How are the life cycles of a ladybug and a frog similar? (a) The young look like the adults in both cycles. (b) The young hatch from eggs in both cycles. (c) Both life cycles begin in a water habitat. (d) Both life cycles have a pupa stage.
output: Both life cycles begin in a water habitat. So the answer is (c).

input: The empty spaces in a material are called pores. Porosity is the amount of empty space within a material. Permeability describes how well the pores in a material are connected. Which of these materials would make the most effective aquifer? (a) a material that has high porosity and high permeability. (b) a material that has high porosity and low permeability. (c) a material that has low porosity and high permeability. (d) a material that has low porosity and low permeability.
output: Option (a) is the most likely answer. So the answer is (a).

input: Why do we see different stars in the sky at different times of the year? (a) The stars are revolving around the Sun. (b) The Moon is revolving around Earth. (c) Earth is revolving around the Sun. (d) The stars are revolving around Earth.
output: The stars are revolving around the Sun. So the answer is (a).

input: Which of these will most likely occur if chemicals from fertilizers run off into lakes and streams? (a) Water quality will improve. (b) Aquatic animals will thrive. (c) Fish will die from a lack of oxygen. (d) Aquatic plants will stop growing.
output: Option (c), fish will die from a lack of oxygen. So the answer is (c).

input: A student identifies a soil sample as "very gritty." What characteristic of the soil did the student describe? (a) texture. (b) hardness. (c) organic content. (d) water retention.
output: The student described the texture of the soil. So the answer is (a).

input: When a tree is dormant, the tree is (a) dying. (b) inactive. (c) growing taller. (d) growing its leaves.
output: A tree is dormant when it is inactive, so the answer is (b).

input: The charge of the nucleus of an atom is due to the presence of (a) positive protons. (b) negative neutrons. (c) negative protons and positive electrons. (d) positive protons and negative neutrons.
output: The charge of the nucleus of an atom is due to the presence of positive protons. So the answer is (a).

input: Earth's hydrosphere is a layer of (1) rock. (2) air. (3) lava. (4) water.
output: The hydrosphere is a layer of water. So the answer is (4).

input: Riding a bicycle produces several forms of energy. Which form of energy is produced in the greatest amount by pedaling a bicycle down the sidewalk? (a) chemical. (b) radiant. (c) kinetic. (d) sound.
output: The greatest amount of energy is produced by pedaling a bicycle down the sidewalk is kinetic energy. So the answer is (c).

input: Which part of a dandelion plant takes in minerals and water? (a) flower. (b) leaf. (c) root. (d) stem.
output: The root of a dandelion plant takes in minerals and water. So the answer is (c).

input: Many natural resources are found in Maryland and the surrounding area. Some of these natural resources are renewable and some are nonrenewable. People use both kinds of resources in daily activities. Using natural resources often produces waste products. Which of these natural resources found in Maryland is nonrenewable? (a) coal. (b) soil. (c) water. (d) wood.
output: Coal is a nonrenewable resource. So the answer is (a).

input: Which surgery is most like the way a transgenic organism is made? (a) Adelle receives an artificial hip to ease her arthritis. (b) Kwan receives a pacemaker to regulate his heartbeat. (c) Hector receives a replacement heart valve from a cow. (d) Denise receives a kidney donated by her identical twin.
output: Option (c), Hector receives a replacement heart valve from a cow. This is the most similar to the way a transgenic organism is made. So the answer is (c).

input: Use the information to answer the question. Over the last 150 years, the use of fossil fuels has increased, resulting in more carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. Some scientists think that these atmospheric gases will result in global warming. Scientists have recorded data on global temperature changes and have predicted possible changes in sea level that may affect Maryland residents. Using fossil fuels in the United States will most likely contribute to rising sea levels globally by (a) increasing oxygen levels. (b) decreasing oxygen levels. (c) increasing carbon dioxide levels. (d) decreasing carbon dioxide levels.
output: The greenhouse gases are increasing the carbon dioxide levels, so the answer is (c).

input: Clouds are formed from tiny drops of water that are light enough to float in the air. As these drops bump into each other, they form larger drops. What happens when these drops become too heavy to float in the air? (a) The drops form fog. (b) The drops evaporate. (c) The drops fall as rain. (d) The drops become air.
output: The drops become too heavy to float in the air, so they fall as rain. So the answer is (c).

input: The shape of a riverbed changes over time as a result of which gradual process? (a) erosion. (b) dissolving. (c) plate shifting. (d) compaction.
output: The shape of a riverbed changes over time as a result of erosion. So the answer is (a).

input: Which statement explains why daylight and darkness occur on Earth? (a) The Earth rotates on its axis. (b) The Sun rotates on its axis. (c) The Earth's axis is tilted. (d) The Earth revolves around the Sun.
output: The Earth rotates on its axis, which causes the Sun to appear to move across the sky. So the answer is (a).

input: Which force causes a soccer ball to fall to the ground after it has been kicked up in the air? (a) erosion. (b) friction. (c) gravity. (d) magnetism.
output: Gravity is the force that causes a soccer ball to fall to the ground after it has been kicked up in the air. So the answer is (c).

input: Which event will occur in an area after a major flood? (a) a decrease in the erosion of riverbanks. (b) a decrease in the number of native plants. (c) an increase in the number of animal habitats. (d) an increase in the diversity of insect species.
output: After a major flood, the number of animal habitats will increase. So the answer is (c).

input: What type of force keeps the planets orbiting the Sun? (a) gravitational. (b) magnetic. (c) electrical. (d) nuclear.
output: The force that keeps the planets orbiting the Sun is gravitational. So the answer is (a).

input: Which gas could cause a glowing splint to burst into flame? (a) Neon. (b) Oxygen. (c) Nitrogen. (d) Carbon dioxide.
output: Oxygen is the only gas that can cause a glowing splint to burst into flame. So the answer is (b).

input: Dr. Wagner is investigating a newly discovered, disease-causing agent. She determines that one structure in the agent is double-stranded RNA. What kind of agent is Dr. Wagner studying? (a) a virus. (b) a protist. (c) a fungus. (d) a bacterium.
output: Option (a), a virus, is the correct answer. Viruses are composed of RNA or DNA. So the answer is (a).

input: Which activity is an important function of nucleases? (a) repairing the double strand of DNA. (b) concentrating RNA into a nucleolus. (c) maintaining homeostasis of nucleoplasm. (d) dissolving the nuclear membrane during mitosis.
output: The function of nucleases is to break down the nucleic acids. So the answer is (a).

input: Which best explains why it is important for a doctor's office to keep accurate records of the medicines prescribed for their patients? (a) to know how many people take medicines. (b) to keep track of all of the people who are sick. (c) to keep track of the next scheduled appointments. (d) to know if there is a risk for harmful side effects.
output: The answer is (d).

input: When light hits a mirror, most of the light is (a) refracted. (b) reflected. (c) absorbed. (d) transmitted.
output: When light hits a mirror, most of the light is reflected. So the answer is (b).

input: A plant scientist is developing a new fertilizer called Hypergrow. She designs an experiment to test whether Hypergrow helps plants grow faster than Supergrow, a fertilizer already on the market. Which of the following should the scientist do with light during the experiment? (a) Apply the same amount of light to all the plants. (b) Apply only green light to all the plants. (c) Flash the lights to simulate a partly cloudy day. (d) Keep the plants in darkness.
output: The scientist should keep the plants in darkness to test the fertilizer. So the answer is (d).

input: The boiling point of water in degrees Celsius is (a) 0°C. (b) 32°C. (c) 100°C. (d) 212°C.
output: The boiling point of water is 100°C. So the answer is (c).

input: A student sorted mineral samples into two groups: dull and shiny. Which of the following properties did the student use to sort the mineral samples into groups? (a) cleavage. (b) color. (c) luster. (d) streak.
output: The student sorted the mineral samples based on luster. So the answer is (c).

input: A 13-year-old boy has blue eyes. Which statement concerning his eye color is correct? (a) It is a result of asexual reproduction. (b) It is a result of childhood nutrition. (c) It is an inherited characteristic. (d) It is a personal choice.
output: The color of the eyes is an inherited characteristic. So the answer is (c).

input: Radioactive waste from nuclear power plants is sealed in containers and deeply buried in the ground. Sealing and burying waste reduces the chances that water will become contaminated. At which point in the water cycle would radioactive contamination most likely be found? (a) rain. (b) fog. (c) groundwater. (d) surface water.
output: Radioactive contamination is most likely to be found in surface water. So the answer is (d).

input: The early Greeks are credited with many valid concepts in astronomy. Some of their theories were correct; some were later proven incorrect. One theory was that Earth was the center of the universe and that other planets circled Earth. The Greeks thought Earth did not move because its movement was not obvious from the surface of the planet. The Greeks also believed that an invisible sphere surrounding our planet contained the stars. This sphere rotated, explaining the apparent movement of constellations over time. Early Greeks also developed theories about the relationship between the moon and Earth. Why is the same side of the moon always visible from Earth? (a) The far side of the moon does not reflect sunlight. (b) The moon stays in one location while Earth revolves around it. (c) The period of rotation and the period of revolution for the moon are about the same. (d) The moon rotates clockwise on its axis while Earth rotates counterclockwise on its axis.
output: The moon rotates on its axis at the same rate that it revolves around Earth. So the answer is (c).

input: Sodium chloride (NaCl) is formed in a chemical reaction between sodium (Na) and chlorine (Cl_{2}). What is sodium chloride? (a) an element. (b) a mixture. (c) a compound. (d) an atom.
output: Sodium chloride is a compound. So the answer is (c).

input: Which group of organisms is most responsible for changing the composition of Earth's early atmosphere? (a) algae. (b) fungi. (c) reptiles. (d) angiosperms.
output: Algae are responsible for changing the composition of Earth's early atmosphere. So the answer is (a).

input: A litter of kittens have traits that are similar to both the mother cat and the father cat. Which best explains this situation? (a) The kittens are provided the same kind of milk from their mother as they grow. (b) The kittens inherit some of their traits from their mother and some from their father. (c) The kittens are kept at the same temperatures by their mother when they are first born. (d) The kittens are taught by their parents to have similar traits.
output: Kittens inherit some of their traits from their mother and some from their father. So the answer is (b).

input: Jessica is making fruit punch for her friends. She pours the powder into a container with sugar and water. Which of these best describes what happens to the sugar? (a) It expands. (b) It dissolves. (c) It condenses. (d) It evaporates.
output: The sugar dissolves in the water. So the answer is (b).

input: The motion of atoms and molecules in a substance is (a) thermal energy. (b) chemical energy. (c) mechanical energy. (d) electromagnetic energy.
output: The motion of atoms and molecules in a substance is thermal energy. So the answer is (a).

input: Which features form when magma emerges between two diverging oceanic plates? (a) ocean trenches. (b) fault boundaries. (c) mid-ocean ridges. (d) composite volcanoes.
output: Mid-ocean ridges form when magma emerges between two diverging oceanic plates. So the answer is (c).
